loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia, 54 years of age, is married and mother of 3 children. She is engaged in the livestock business, hog-raising. She has been in this business for almost 15 years. Her net income is 13,000 PHP, and she's asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional livestock feed to supplement her hogs. She hopes to continue to avail loans and to achieve her dreams for her children, through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Celerino

texts.en:
Celerina is 61 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 3 years and also earns an income from E-loading.  Celerina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items to sell.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a massage service business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase massage oils and lotions for her business. In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase massage oils and lotions for her massage (hilot) business.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 44 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. Her husband supports her in the business and others family needs. Naomi buys and sells fuel (kerosene, petrol and diesel) and molasses. Naomi has been in this business for the last nine years. She has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Limited, to buy more stock of fuel to sell.

Naomi dreams and hopes for her business to grow well so that she will be able to pay back her loan. She hope to be able to save enough to buy a plot of land in order for her to built residential houses for renting.

loans.use: to purchase stock fuel to sell.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 20-year-old university student and also works as a construction worker to cover his school expenses. Iyad couldn't work in the last semester hence he had to borrow from FATEN to pay for next semester's tuition fees and decided to use part of the loan to pay for his family house maintenance.

Iayd, who appears in the picture here, will cover house painting from the loan he received from FATEN.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees and house improvements.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia, 55 years of age, is married to a farmer and they have been blessed with 1 child. She has been in the livestock business for almost 2 years. Her net income, when she sells 2 hogs, is 13,000 PHP. She's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase some hogs to raise. She will sell the hogs after three to four months. She feels glad that her business income is now enough to support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase some hogs to raise.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lerma works hard to support her family.

She has a balut-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Lerma is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more eggs and to maintain her processing for balut-making.

Lerma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and to maintain her processing for balut-making

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her welding shop business.

Lina has been in this business for 20 years. Lina earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to  afford to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her welding shop

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 60 years old and married with 12 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Amelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed for her pigs and dried fish to sell.

Amelita has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. Chea, 56, and his wife, 55, support their family by fishing with fishing implements along the Tunle Sap River. This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect their money after their buyers sell all of the fish that they bought. Mr. Chea has five children. Two of his children are single and three are married. Two of the children work as fish catchers also. Mr. Chea is not comfortable because his house often needs to be repaired. He would like a loan to repair his old house.

loans.use: to repair his old house.

loans.name: Kimsang

texts.en:
Kimsang, 27 years old, raises pigs at home. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $7 per day. They are married with two children, 3 and 1 year old. 

Every month, she has to spend $15 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $10 for other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to go to work and as a motor taxi when he is free from his work. 

She wants to have a big pen to raise more pigs. Also, though her children are still young now, they will start school soon, so she needs to save money for them when they are ready for school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's career.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Elenita is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase fish nets and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to earn and save enough money expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 64 years old and married with nine children. Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. 

For the past five years, Basilisa has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from pig fattening, and from the sale of ready-to-wear clothes and bags. She is requesting a 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, like milk and sugar, to sell in her general store. 

Before this loan, Basilisa has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF. Basilisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock, like milk and sugar, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
For the last three years Samuel has been operating a retail electronic  shop in Murungaru area, Ndunyu Njeru town. He is 31 years old and married to Jane. They are blessed with one child.

Samuel was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, who is also a KADET client. This will be his third loan. He paid back his previous loan of KES 60,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy inventory of electronic goods for his shop, to resell. 

In the future, Samuel aspires to open a wholesale electronics shop and to supply electronic goods for the whole of Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy stock of electronic goods for his shop.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 56 years old and married with one child.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lucena is requesting a 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store. Before this loan, she has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF. 

Lucena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Willa

texts.en:
Willa, a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato, primarily grows corn crops to sell. She also raises pigs in her backyard which she sells at the market. A widow who works hard to feed her children and send them to school, Willa plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, pig feed, and vitamins.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman in order to ensure that her children have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pig feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 43 years old, married, and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. Erna works very hard to provide for them as the operator of a general store in the Philippines for the past 13 years. Selling a variety of items such as fruits, coffee, powdered milk and other groceries, she is now requesting a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

In the future, Erna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more store stocks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en: Marifel is 28 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Marifel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store. Marifel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, noodles, curls, etc. In the future, Marifel would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sain

texts.en:
Sain, 50 years old, is a farmer who raises pigs at home. Her husband is also a farmer and a motor taxi driver. Their income is $25 per day. They have six children. Two are studying and four are working in the factory. 

Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees and $10 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to open a small grocery shop at home. She still will raise pigs but she wants to have another career to get more income. 

Before, she sold only paddies, and then she started raising pigs to get baby pigs to sell, but the income is still up and down, so she wants to have a steady career. That’s why she wants to sell groceries at home. Her long-term goal is to support her children to study at least through high school.

loans.use: To open a small grocery shop at home.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is 65 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Natividad has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Natividad requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business. Natividad has been in this business for five years. In the future, Natividad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional items for selling.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: As a married parent of eight children, Emma works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fresh fish in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional fresh fish to sell. Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy over-the-counter medicines, disposable diapers and personal hygiene items.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 33-year-old wife and mother. Her husband and she have worked at saving money since they got married to buy their own house one day. Fatima and Ibrahim (her husband who is photographed above instead of conservative Fatima) were able to fulfill their dream and buy a house.

Fatima took out a loan from FATEN to cover construction workers' wages for house finishing (painting and installing sinks)  as they want to have the house done before next winter.

loans.use: to pay for house finishing: painting and installing sinks.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 55 years old, sells groceries at home. Her husband is also a groceries seller but he sells at school. Their income is $36 per day. They have four children. Three are studying and one is working in a company for $6 per day. 

Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on rent, $50 on school fees and $10 for transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy equipment for selling food. It is her new career. Because she wants to send all of her children to study in the university, she needs to get more money to support them, and selling food is a good career in the place she is staying. If she can save much money she wishes to buy a small shop in the market.

loans.use: To buy material and equipment to sell food.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia comes from village Kakabeti, Kakheti Region. She is 45 years old and lives with husband David, their 19-year-old daughter (a student) and her parents-in-law. Lia works in a local school as a deputy director. Besides her regular job, she takes part in the family agricultural business, which is the main source of income for the family. 

Lia’s family owns agricultural land, where melons (1 hectare), grapes (1.5 hectares)  and Lucerne (alfalfa, 5 hectares) are grown. Melons and grapes are sold to fruit wholesalers and Lucerne is sold to the neighbor farmers, who use it for feeding their livestock. Along with the above-mentioned, Lia and David run a sheep-breeding farm, which consists of 40 sheep and lambs. They sell lambs in the spring season. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris, including the pension of Lia’s parents-in-law. 

Though the family has quite a strong farm, they still are faced by lack of cash for financing seasonal costs. Because of this, Lia requested a loan for mowing Lucerne (to hire special mowing machinery) and purchasing fertilizers for their melon garden. Mowed Lucerne will be stored and sold. After fertilizing the land, the family will get more harvest and thus more income from sales. 

The increase in income will be used for financing Lia’s daughter’s education in high school.

loans.use: to hire a mowing machine and purchase fertilizers for melon garden.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, a 31-year-old married father of two children, lives in Tyre-South Lebanon where he has worked as a barber since 1996. Working hard in order to provide his family with a good living standard and education, he is talented in his business and loved by most of his clients who are mainly friends, neighbors and relatives.

Having already borrowed twice from Al Majmoua with very good business results, Ahmad is requesting his third loan in order to do needed redecoration and buy some necessary new equipment and products for his shop. Ahmad hopes to expand his business and improve his family's social and financial situation in the future.

loans.use: to do needed redecoration and buy necessary equipment and products for his shop.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 47 years old, is a sugarcane juice seller. Her husband is a coconut shaver. Their income is $11 per day. They have six children, but only one of them is still studying. 

Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 for other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike and a carriage to sell shaved coconut, sugarcane juice and eggs together. 

Before, her family were farmers, but the income was so bad that she couldn't support the children in school, so her husband wants to do another career to get more income to support the family and he found shaving coconut is the best one to start. He has found that he can make a good income from this career, so he would like to continue and make it better.  

She would like to send all of her children to school until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a carriage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to the money the borrower has and buy a rickshaw.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jacinta is 43 years old. Four of her children are in school.

Jacinta has an eatery business in the Philippines. Jacinta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jacinta has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jacinta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Angelie has been in this business for three years. Angelie earns more income from movie tapes & DVDs rentals.

Angelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. Milagros is married and has a business buying & selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Milagros requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of fish to make dried fish to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Milagros would like to repair & renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fish to make dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en: Ramona is 64 years old and married with seven children. Ramona works very hard to provide for them. Ramona runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her variety store. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, biscuits, canned goods, curls, candies and other groceries. In the future, Ramona would like to save enough to buy a rice farm.

loans.use: to buy items like eggs, biscuits, groceries, etc., to sell in her variety store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 52-year-old Mrs. Seang's daily routine. She provides her services to her neighbors – sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and she is always adding new clients who need her to sew their clothes. 

Mrs. Seang is a widow woman, and she divorced her husband when her two children were still young. Mrs. Seang will use half of her loan to buy a cow for breeding and the rest to build a new hedge for her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding and build a new hedge for her house.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 58 years old and married with seven children. Paterna works very hard to provide for them.

Paterna runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Paterna has been in this business for two years and she sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, shampoo, noodles etc. 

In the future Paterna would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. He is 66 years old and is married to Rachael. They are blessed with three school-going children. 

Sammy got to know about KADET LTD from his friend who is also a KADET LTD client. This will be his fourth loan. He has repaid his previous loans well and in good time.  Sammy plans to use this loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seedlings, to pay for labor, and to buy one cow. 
 
In the future, Sammy hopes to increase his farm production by practicing large-scale farming.

loans.use: buy farm inputs, pay for labour, and buy a cow

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merle is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Merle has a rope making business in the Philippines. Merle requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her rope making.

Merle has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Merle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making.

loans.name: Musyoka

texts.en:
Musyoka is 51-year-old man. He is married and is blessed with six children. Musyoka is a charcoal dealer in Kongowea, Mombasa.  His business has been in operation for the last two years. 

Musyoka has been a KADET client and this marks his first loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase more charcoal for his business.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to provide for his family.  His dream is to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 55 years old and married with eight children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari sari store.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from carenderia and vegetables vending.

Zenaida aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri lives in village Sartichala, Kakheti Region. He lives with his wife Tamar and three children – 2 daughters (17 and 16 years old) and his 5-year-old son. 

Badri works as a driver in a local company. Also he helps Tamar in their family-owned dairy farm. They have two milk cows, which give them approximately 20 liters of milk per day. From the milk Tamar makes approximately 55 kg of cheese per month and sells it on the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris, including Badri’s salary. This amount isn’t enough for the family to provide their children and themselves with all necessary books, toys and household goods. 

Badri requested credit to purchase an additional milk cow and calves. With three cows, Tamar will be able to produce and sell 50% more cheese. The calves will be raised and sold in fall for an increased price. 

An increase in income will allow the family to purchase more goods for their children and more household items, which will improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and two calves for the dairy farm.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 45-year-old married woman living and working in Tyre with her husband and four children. Fatima lives in a very modest house and she's always thankful for what she gets. She works in order to help in her family's income and cover their expenses.  She started working in 2005 and her business is growing gradually.

Fatima is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time to increase her business capital and stock up on summer makeup and perfume collections.  She hopes her business improves more in the future so she can buy the necessary furniture for her house and open a small shop to move her business out of her house.

loans.use: buy summer makeup, perfumes and cosmetics accessories

loans.name: Supheap

texts.en:
Supheap, 39 years old, produces rice wine to sell. Her husband is a cattle seller. They have seven children. Four are studying and two are working in the factory. Her husband can get a good income from his career, so she wants to borrow $1,000 to buy the cattle for him to sell. 

Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $9 on electricity and rent, $15 on school fees, and $15 for other expenses. She wants to buy more cattle to keep and sell when a good price comes, and she wants to send the rest of her children to study until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell when a good price comes.

loans.name: Serphine

texts.en:
Serphine is 36 years old and is married.  She runs a boutique in Mikindani, Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last three years. 

Serphine has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase bales of clothes and shoes to sell in her business.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to support her family. Her dream is to own several outlets in the future.

loans.use: purchase clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She lives with her family in the town of Banga, South Cotabato.

Analyn is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell.  She also raises pigs in her backyard and makes "chorizo" to sell to the people in her community. She plans to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Analyn hopes that this loan to help improve her farming business.

loans.use: ourchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea is a long-time businesswoman and a low-income person. She has been operating a small business since 2000. In the hedge of Bakorng primary school, she owns a kiosk where she sells different kinds of cake and candy for kids when they take a rest and she earns around US $3 per day. Mrs. Chea is married to 31-year-old Hun, who is a domestic construction worker in and around Siem Reap Province. The couple is blessed with three kids; two of them are enrolled in school and one is still very young. In order to subtract traveling costs, Mrs. Chea will use her loan to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to ride to his job location.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to ride to his job location.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase raw materials to make sofa sets

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia works hard to support her family. Crescencia is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Crescencia requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like biscuits and groceries, in her sari-sari store.

Crescencia has been in this business for 31 years.

In the future, Crescencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like biscuits and groceries, in her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mardia

texts.en:
Mardia is 36 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 2 and 5, five are attending school.  Her husband is a businessman.

For the past years Mardia has been operating a small Entertainment center and she enjoys it a whole lot, because she makes a lot of profit.

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks (beer, soda, wine, etc) for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children and send them to quality schools.

loans.use: purchase beer, soda, wine, etc. for her business

loans.name: Atuwezeshe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Uwineza représentante du groupe d’affaire « Atuwezeshe»,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants, tous étudient. Son mari est un enseignant dans une école conventionnée évangélique. Elle est  sociétaire d’un petit restaurant-cafeteria installé dans le quartier Ndosho.  Avant son mariage, elle exerçait cette même activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  50 kg de haricots, 25 kg de sucre, laits, café, 2 casiers de Fanta, Primus, etc., le reste d’argent servira pour payer les frais académiques pour son mari, qui bientôt,  va défendre son baccalauréat (BAC+3) pour les cours  vespéraux.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Atuwezeshe» est majoritairement féminins.Certaines femmes sont très joviales avec leurs bébés au dos.
texts.en:
The client Uwineza, leader of the business group "Atuwezeshe," is an entrepreneur. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, all in school. Her husband is a teacher in an evangelical school. She is a member of a small restaurant-cafeteria located in the Ndosho neighborhood. She has been in the same business since before she got married. Meanwhile, she has just finished six loan cycles with Hekima.

This new loan will be used to buy 50 kg of beans, 25 kg of sugar, milk, coffee, and 2 cases of Fanta, Primus, etc. The rest of the money will be used to pay school fees for her husband, who will soon pass his baccalaureate (BAC+3) for evening classes.

Furthermore, her goals are to educate her children and build a comfortable house. She thanks Hekima for its efforts in favor of poor women not served by traditional banking. 

It should be said that the business group "Atuwezeshe" is mainly composed of female members. Some of the women appear very jovial with their babies on their backs.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of beans, 25 kg of sugar, milk, cafe, and 2 cases of Fanta, Prima, etc., and to pay for schooling.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bethy

texts.en: Bethy is 57 years old and is a married woman with 1 child. Bethy is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn. She also raises pigs to sell. Bethy works hard to help provide for her family's needs. She has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and feeds. She hopes that this loan will help improve her businesses.

loans.use: purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amelita is 43 years old and has two children who are in school. Amelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her stall. Amelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizers, pesticides and seedlings, pay for labor, and buy two bulls

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine, age 35, runs a tailoring business in Bamburi, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last two years. Josphine is an existing  KADET client, and this is the second loan she has accessed to help finance her business. 

With this loan, she plans to purchase a sewing machine and cloth. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to help support her family her family. 

Her dream is to own a boutique in future.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Bosco

texts.fr: Bosco est client d’ACB depuis 2009,il est célibataire , il a 27 ans ,il n’a aucune  personne en charge ,et il est ne  au Rwandais.il a niveau d’éducation de 6 ans des études secondaire(A2)  .C’est son deuxième cycle de  prêt et il n'a aucun difficulte de remboursement.Il va utiliser le prêt pour acheter 15 kgs des clous ,20L de vidange,60 pièces de tôles et payer main d’œuvre pour la construction de sa maison de commerce. Sa stratégie pour la croissance  de l’affaire est augmenté la capacité de son affaire en vue de s’autofinancer. Dans l’avenir il voudrait construire d’autres maisons à usage résidentiel, pour sa famille et acheter  les parcelles.il est aussi le salarié, agent du district.
texts.en:
Bosco has been an ACB client since 2009. He is single, 27 years old, and he does not support any other people. This is his second loan cycle, and he has had no trouble with repayment.

He will use this loan to buy 15 kg of nails, 20 liters of used motor oil, and 60 pieces of sheet metal, and also to pay labor costs for the construction of his place of business. His strategy for business growth is to increase his capacity in order to self-finance.

In the future he would like to build other residential homes for his family and to buy land. He is also employed as a district agent.

loans.use: to buy 15 kg of nails, 20 liters of used motor oil and 60 pieces of sheet metal, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is 34 years old and married with two children. He and his wife own a store selling fruit, vegetables and basic commodities.

He plans to get a loan to partly invest in his business and to partly cover the cost of school fees for his children. 

He and his wife hope that the expansion of their business will enable them to earn more income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To invest capital in their business and cover the cost of school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase five used fridges to resell or use parts for fixing fridges in his workshop.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, age 32, runs a clothing business in Mombasa’s Kiembeni estate. Her business has been in operation for the last two years. She is unmarried and is the mother of two children.

Judith is an existing KADET client and this will be the second time she has accessed loan to help finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase bedsheets and doormats to offer for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to support her family.

Her dream is to own larger business premises in future.

loans.use: to purchase bedsheets and doormats to offer for sale

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em, 23, is divorced and looks after her daughter by selling coffee and mobile cards, which she has done for the past three years. She and her daughter live in Ho Chi Minh City.

She would like to take a loan to expand her business by selling a greater variety of goods. She hopes that this will increase her income and permit her to better feed and meet the basic needs of her daughter and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman, age 51, has owned and operated a grocery store since 1999. In addition to grocery items, she sells a number of gifts and gadgets, which she added to her inventory in order to increase her income. She lives in Tyre with her husband and two children.

Iman is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital by purchasing gift items and summer beverages to offer for sale. She also intends to use some of the profits from her loan funds to continue building her family house.

This is Iman's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan helped her to introduce new products to her business, and this investment helped to increase her income.

Iman works hard on improving and expanding her business so that she can help to provide her family with the best possible standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase gift items and summer beverages to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, age 42, runs a timber workshop in Bombolulu, Mombasa. His business thas been in operation for the last six years. He and his wife have three children. 

Jacob is an existing KADET client and this will be the second loan he has accessed to help finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase more timber to use for making furniture to offer for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to support his family. 

His dream is to own a chain of timber workshops in future.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to use for making furniture to offer for sale

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 45 years old and married with two children. Her husband works at farming and raising cattle.

For nearly 10 years, she has run a small street-side restaurant selling meals, soups, and noodles in the local community. 

She now intends to get a loan to repair her street-side restaurant and purchase cattle for resale. She hopes that the loan will increase her income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To repair her street-side restaurant and purchase cattle

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 53, is a married woman with three children: one son and two daughters. Her husband works in transportation. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

For nearly 10 years, Hong has supported her family through the income she earns from her store that occupies the front of her house. Her store sells a small variety of goods. She intends to take a loan to buy a larger variety of different goods to stock her store and better meet her customers' needs. She hopes her expanded business will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of goods to stock her store

loans.name: Nort

texts.en:
Nort, 38 years old, is a sugar palm seller. Her husband is a cattle seller. They have five children 24, 17, 15, 13, and 8 years old. Three of them are studying and one is working in the factory. 

Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 electricity, $3 on rent, $20 on school fees and $15 for other expenses. Almost all of the expenses are paid by her husband's career because he can make a good profit from it. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy cattle to resell. She expects that this loan will lead her family to live in a better condition, and she will be able to get a better income to support all of her children to study at least through high school.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh is 45 years old and married with two children: one son and one daughter. Her husband works as a carpenter.

She supports her family by selling meals in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy better food to sell at higher margins. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better food to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Rosemary has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town. She is 34 years old. She and her husband John have four children, all enrolled in school.

Rosemary was introduced to KADET Ltd by her friend, an existing KADET client. This will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of KES 30,000 in full and on schedule. 

She plans to use her new loan amount to buy a cow, purchase fertilizers, hire a temporary farm laborer, and buy chemicals to spray on her crops.

In the future, Rosemary aspires to practice large-scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy a cow, purchase fertilizers, hire a temporary farm laborer, and buy chemicals to spray on her crops

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mr. Im is 52 years old, living in Baray district. He runs a horse-cart taxi, providing service for passengers or for picking goods up. He earns a profit of $3 a day to help meet his family's expenses. He is married with eight children – four of them are single and the rest are married and living away from home. Most of them are employed in different occupations. His wife is a rice farmer. 

Mr. Im often helps his wife with the business growing crops when he has time away from his horse-cart taxi. Mr. Im is looking for Kiva funds to use to pay for plowing costs and to purchase insecticides, seeds, and fertilizers for growing the crop well.

loans.use: to pay plowing costs and to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a variety of stock for her store

loans.name: Mumuwa Community Bank Group

texts.en:
Aisha is a member of the Mumuwa Community Bank Group (pictured here). She earns an income by raising and selling poultry. This has been her business for eight years now. The mother of four operates her business from Mpigi. Previous to launching this business, she operated a restaurant. It was capital from that endeavor that enabled her to take root in the poultry business. 

Aisha tells us that her monthly sales profits total up to about 600,00 shillings. She also ekes out additional revenue from a modest food sales business. 

With this loan, she reports that she plans to purchase more chicken mash and essential medications for her chickens.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken mash and essential medications for her chickens

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda, age 33, runs a retail shop in Mombasa Kiembeni estate. Her business has been in operation for the last year. She and her husband have one child.
 
Emelda has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. With this loan, she plans to increase her inventory of cooking oil, flour, rice, and sugar. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to help support her family.
 
Her dream is to own a big shop in future.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cooking oil, flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien, 34, is a married woman with two children. Her husband makes bicycle frames to earn a living. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hien is requesting a loan to buy machines that will enable her to work and assist her husband to increase their production of bicycle frames. She hopes that this will assist her and her husband to make a higher income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy machines to make bicycle frames

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her two daughters and her husband. 

They earn money by cleaning vehicles and selling spare parts. With the minimal capital that they have, they sometimes cannot provide the parts required by their customers. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of spare parts to meet their customers' needs. 

She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her daughters, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to offer for sale through her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old. He is married and has four children, none of whom are currently in school. John has a small retail shop, which he has run for four years.
To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as sugar. With the help of his loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as sugar.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung, 58, is a married woman with four children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. She makes money to feed her family members by selling groceries from the door of her home. 

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater variety of stock. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of stock

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 54-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She has been selling groceries from her door for 10 years. Her husband is a driver. 

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing stock and refitting the front of her house. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions. She also hopes to be able to save part of the income she earns in case the family encounters any future difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase more stock and refit the front of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer and assorted hair products for use in her salon

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is 35 years old. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have been running a small cafe selling beverages and food to people in the local community since 2004. They have requested a loan to buy furniture and a variety of different foods for the cafe in order to attract more customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and helps her to improve her income and living conditions.

loans.use: To buy furniture and stock for her cafe

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 50 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Mariam has a grocery business selling food, which she has run for five years. She also has a second business selling vegetables.
To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and other basic items for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung, 41 years old, is married and has two children. She supports her family through the income she earns from her store that occupies the front of her house. Her store sells a small variety of goods. Her husband is a truck driver. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She intends to take loans to buy a larger variety of different goods to stock her store and better meet her customers' needs. She hopes her business runs smoothly and helps her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of different goods for her store

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera and her husband have a grocery store. They are parents of three daughters and three sons who are school students. Sameera and her husband wanted to increase sales and attract more customers, therefore Sameera took a loan from FATEN to pay for a larger amount of goods and increase the variety sold in their store.

Sameera's husband appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in their grocery store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband works as a local administrator. To earn more money to support her family, in 2009 she started a grocery store that occupies the front of her house. Her store sells a small variety of goods. She intends to take a loan to buy a larger variety of different goods to stock her store and better meet her customers' needs.

She hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, age 35, operates a cereals and grocery business in the Munyole trading center. He has been in this business for the last six years and this has been his only source of income. From this business, he earns a profit of KES 4,000 a month. He and his wife have four children, all enrolled in school.

Peter is eager to grow both aspects of his business. In order to boost his endeavor, Peter is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 from KADET Ltd. He intends to use the money to purchase beans to offer for resale at a profit. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business and to repay the loan. 

His dream is eventually to own a milling company and to give his family the best life he can afford to offer.

loans.use: to purchase beans to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy better quality fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil, age 48, is a tailor. He has worked in tailoring for 27 years and opened his own business in 1997. He is a hard worker, and his considerable experience gives him a special position in his domain: in addition to offering his services to local neighbors, friends, and relatives, he has customers who come to him from several neighboring villages as well. Khalil lives with his wife and five children in Tyre.
 
Khalil is has been with Kiva partner Al Majmoua for seven consecutive lending cycles. All his previous loans have had a positive impact on his social and financial situation, and he is a borrower in good standing. He works hard on improving both his business and his family's situation, and he gives special attention and care to his customers, whom he values highly as his main source of living.

Khalil is requesting this loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary textiles for his business. He will also use part of it to help his son to continue building his family house.

loans.use: to buy necessary textiles for his business and to help his son to continue building his family house.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 51-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have had a business making pallets since 2000. It is running smoothly and she would like to take a loan to expand production and buy materials in bulk to increase the profitability of her business. 

She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy in bulk materials to make pallets

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is  29 years old, married and a mother of one child. She has been operating a fast food kiosk in Chaani, Mombasa for the last three years. 

Catherine has been a KADET client and this marks her third loan to finance her business. She plans to use this loan to purchase flour, cooking oil and groceries for her cafe. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to maintain her family. Catherine's dream is to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil and groceries for her cafe

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang, 54, is married and has been supporting his family by making and selling dumplings. He lives with his three children and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife also helps him to run their business.

Hoang has been in the dumpling business since 2003. He plans to use this loan for investment capital to increase production.  

In the future, he would like to stablzse his living conditions and get a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make dumplings to sell

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang and his family live in Ho Chi Minh City. He is 54 years old and has four sons and two daughters. 

He and his wife are retired and have been earning money by selling beverages at their door for the past four years.

Sang would like to borrow money to expand his business and hopes that this will enable him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more beverages

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She has been raising poultry and farming for eight years. Her husband is a driver. 

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing poultry and farming stock. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to generate more capital for her work and enough money to bring their children up.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and farming stock

loans.name: Xuan Tuan

texts.en:
Tuan, a 42-year-old single man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He has a cleaning business that cleans vehicles. 

Tuan requires a loan to purchase better equipment that will enable him to provide better services for his customers. He hopes that better equipment will permit him to work more efficiently and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase better equipment to clean vehicles

loans.name: Usukhjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Usukhjargal is 40 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is a university student and her daughter is 5 years old. Usukhjargal's husband has worked as a repairman at “Power Plant 3” since 2008.

Usukhjargal is self-employed and has 4 sewing machines. She sews and then sells summertime “deel” (traditional Mongolian clothing) and shirts and wintertime leather jackets. Usukhjargal is planning to use this loan to buy more cloth and textiles to produce more deels and traditional shirts in order to fulfill the increased demand for her products in the summer and to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and textiles

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 21-year-old mother of two daughters and one son. Her husband appears in the picture here instead of her as she is a conservative woman from GAZA. He is a taxi driver. Her husband wants to pay maintenance expenses therefore she took out a loan from FATEN to cover those expenses.

Nida's husband is saving money to purchase a new taxi soon.

loans.use: to pay taxi maintenance expenses.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 37 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a driver. In 2009, she created a store to sell food and beverages in the local community. 

She plans to get a loan to partly invest capital in her business by purchasing more foods and beverages for resale and partly to use as school fees for their children. 

She and her husband hope that the loan will assist them to earn more income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase food and beverages for resale and to invest in the education of her children

loans.name: Firas

texts.en: Firas (who appears in the picture) is a 24-year-old Palestinian National Authority employee. He was recently married and is still furnishing his small apartment. Firas took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a kitchen and install it in his house, as his salary is not enough to cover the costs (especially after the money he spent on wedding arrangements and other household items).

loans.use: to purchase a kitchen for a new house.

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is a Palestinian National Authority employee and the father of one daughter, Nada, and three sons: Atef, Khaled and Fayez. Jaber has a small farm and raises goats. He started the farm three years ago to support his family as his [job] won't be enough when the children are older.

Jaber (who appears in the picture) took out a loan from FATEN to purchase new species of goats to produce stronger goats with better milk production, which will insure a better price when sold.

loans.use: to purchase different species of goats.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a mother of one daughter and two sons. Her young children do not have bedroom furniture yet as the parents are employees with very decent salaries but couldn't afford bedroom furniture. The couple could save a small amount of money to purchase the bedroom furniture but they needed more to be able to buy good furniture that would last for a long time, as they won't be able to replace it any time soon.

Manal took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the furniture. Manal's husband appears in the picture here instead, as she is a conservative woman from GAZA.

loans.use: to purchase bedroom furniture for the children

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is an honest and hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. Fotima has operated a business selling women’s fabrics for 10 years. She purchases fabrics wholesale and then sells them to her customers. Fotima works hard in order to better her living conditions. She started her business by selling small items. Fotima would like to get a loan of 6,500 TJS to purchase new fabrics and increase her working capital in order to make a good profit.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Fawzeyya

texts.en:
Fawzeyya is a 52-year-old mother of two daughters and two sons. She was married 30 years ago and never changed the furniture since then.. Fawzeyya took out a loan from FATEN to add to the money she saved and replaced the furniture.

Fawzeyya is a Palestinian woman who knows of her good reputation. Fawzeya's husband appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to replace her 30-year-old furniture

loans.name: Hau

texts.en:
Hau is 51 years old and married with three children: two sons and one daughter. He and his wife have had a store for five years.

He would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for his business, which will enabL. him to buy better goods to sell at higher margins. 

He hopes that through the loan he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy stock for his store

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
Ismoil has been running a farming business for 6 years. He is a hardworking man and has two children. He has 20 hundredths of land where he cultivates potatoes, carrots and onions. He sells his crops in the “Shurnavo” market and makes a good profit. Ismoil is also engaged in animal husbandry. He would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS to increase his working capital and expand his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the house and furnish it to fit the eight-member family

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 22 years old and single. He has operated a business selling secondhand clothes door-to-door in Milango Saba, Mombasa, for one year and is doing well. 

Charles was introduced to KADET LTD recently and this marks his first loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase secondhand shirts and women's clothes to resell. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business. Charles' dream is to become a very successful businessman and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand shirts and women's clothes to resell

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiro Nakawuka Group

texts.en:
Zzeridda's cinema business is now 7 years old. This kind of entertainment is a booming business, especially in many urban areas of western Uganda. Zzeridda mostly shows Nigerian movies, which are the fascination of many people in Uganda at present.

Zzeridda, a 27-year-old happily married mother of one, says her best friend inspired her to join this business. Before that, she was mostly inclined to a modest poultry business. Zzeridda says success in her business has come from hard work and being friendly to her clients. The business generates 120,000 UGX weekly. Zzeridda plans to use this loan to purchase new movie DVDs to show at her cinema.

loans.use: to purchase new movie DVD'S to show at her cinema

loans.name: Noura

texts.en:
Noura is a 37-year-old married woman living in Tyre with her husband and four children. Noura has been making and selling souvenirs since 2007. She prepares souvenirs for childbirth, marriage, engagements and many more occasions as requested. Noura likes her job a lot and works hard on improving it. This type of handmade business is expanding nowadays in Lebanon. Noura has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles. Her previous loans were very impressive and she has been a good standing borrower. She is requesting a new loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools and decorating products and to buy living room furniture for her house.

Noura also makes artificial flowers and is an expert in this field. She helps her husband cover their expenses and hopes to expand her business more by improving her candle work and opening a small shop.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and decorating products and to buy living room furniture

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в городе Худжанд. Он женат. Имеет двоих детей. Ему 47 лет. У него среднее образование. Он занимается продажей овощей на рынке "Фаровон". Этим видом деятельности он занимается 14 лет. Бахтиёр хочет расширить свою деятельность. Поэтому он берет кредит в Хумо. Он берет кредит в основном для покупки в оптом картошки и лука. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве, она занимается растениеводством.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor  lives in the town of Khujand. He is married, with two children. He is 47 years old. He has completed secondary education. He sells vegetables at the “Farovon” market. He has been in this line of work for 14. Bakhtiyor would like to expand his business. This is why he is taking out a loan from MLO Humo. He is taking out a loan mainly to buy potatoes and onions wholesale. His wife works at a collective farm. She  grows crops.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in order to expand his business

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a Palestinian National Authority employee. He is married and has two daughters and three sons. Husam took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home furniture.

Husam, who appears in the picture here, lives in Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Vang is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

To earn an income, Vang has sold meals in a food stall for the past 16 years. Her husband sells fish in a small market.

She intends to take a loan to buy better food to attract more customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy better food to attract more customers

loans.name: Githinji

texts.en:
Githinji is  37 years old, married and a father of five children. He has been selling clothes in Mombasa’s Mshomoroni estate for the last eight years and has been doing well. 

This loan marks Githinji's first borrowing from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more clothing stock to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and for his family's upkeep. Githinji’s dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is a 41-year-old single woman. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She has owned a general store that sells a lot of basic commodities in her local community for nearly 15 years. She would like to take a loan to expand her business by buying more goods for resale. 

She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her life.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber and to install electricity in his premises

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is 55 years old. She is divorced and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her three children. 

Luong runs a cafe, which she began eight years ago. The income source from the cafe helps her to feed her children and maintain their living conditions. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of beverages and food to meet her customers' needs. 

She hopes her business will ensure that her family members have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more beverages and food to sell

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a 31-year-old mother of one daughter and three sons. Her children are young school students. Ibtesam's husband owns a poultry shop where he prepares chicken for sale and cooking.

Ibtesam's husband needs a new machine for chicken cleaning as the one he has is old and has been repaired many times. She took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the new machine and enhance the work.

Nidal, Ibtesam's husband, appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman like most of Jabalia Refugee camp inhabitants.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine to clean chickens

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam is married and has 6 children. His wife is a housewife. Uktam sells different household accessories such as columns, lamps, batteries, chargers, flashlights, etc. He has successfully operated this business for 11 years. His current working capital is 40,000 TJS.

Uktam travels four times a month to the city of Dushanbe, where he purchases goods amounting, on average, to 6,000 TJS. All his taxes are paid on time and he has regular customers. Uktam would like to get a loan of 12,500 TJS to purchase more columns, lamps, batteries, chargers, flashlights, etc. in order to expand his business and to make a good profit. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy columns, lamps, batteries, chargers, flashlights, etc.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai is a 39-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband is a driver. She has been making money by sewing garments. This job brings in a small income to support for her family. Lai has started a garment shop and hired some local women to work together. She would like to take a loan to expand production by buying three sewing machines, one overlocking machine and material in bulk to increase the profitability of her business. 

She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy three sewing machines and one overlocking machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband. In 2005, she started running her own business working as a hairdresser receiving clients at her home. She has worked in this occupation for eight years. With her business income, she is helping to supplement the household income. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies. She is in real need of getting those materials so that she can improve her business. In the future, she hopes to open a formal beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Navoidin

texts.en:
Navoidin is active, responsible and single.  He transports building materials and furniture back and forth between Vorukh and Khujand.   Navoidin would like a 13,000 TJS loan to purchase apricots.  He will use the profit he earns from processing and selling the dried fruit for his wedding.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. The country has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. It is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it is home to a complex mix of Islam, Soviet culture, western culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet Republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve the country's agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy apricots to process and sell.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 60-year-old widow with two children. She lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Over the past 30 years, Mai has taken care of her children through her business selling pork in a small local market.

The business' profit covers all of her family expenses and there is very little left over. She would like to have a loan to invest in and expand her current business, which she will use to purchase larger quantities of meat for resale. She hopes that she will be able to earn a higher income and set aside part of her earnings to cover any family emergencies.

loans.use: to invest in her current business by purchasing more meat for resale

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of two children.  Since 2002, she has sold cosmetics and makeup for a living.  Amal helps her husband earn the family income and cover most of their expenses. She requests a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school fees. 

Amal has borrowed from Al Majmoua for three consecutive cycles.  The organization has helped her to improve her business and family's social and financial situation.  Her main aim is for her children's education and health and she tries her best to work to meet their needs.  Amal hopes to expand her business and open a shop instead of visiting clients homes.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools and supplies

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 34 years old and married to Gabriel.  They have two children who are six and 12 years old.  Jacinta runs a retail shop, earning a profit of KES. 6,000 a month.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 10,000 to boost her business by adding stock of items like rice, tealeaves and washing detergents for resale. This loan is her first from Kiva partner KADET LTD.  

Jacinta will use the anticipated profits to invest back into her  business for it to grow and in future she plans to own a wholesale shop.  Her hopes and dreams are to improve her business as well as the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock of more items in her retail shop like rice, tea leaves and washing detergents so as to improve her retail business.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad and her husband have a perfume store selling perfumes that are produced from perfume oil. Suad has three sons. Suad and her husband want to expand the store and start selling accessories. They are maintaining a good reputation and they want to seize the opportunity and attract more clients by starting to sell accessories.

Suad's husband is photographed in the store, as she is a conservative woman from Jabalia Refugee camp.

loans.use: to purchase accessories to sell

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a 51-year-old married man who lives in Aley with his wife and four children.  Amir sells fish, work he has done for 12 years. He loves his job and works hard to improve it.  Amir owns the only fish shop in his region, which helps increase his income since there is no competition.  He tries his best to keep his customers satisfied and loyA..

Amir requests a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to buy a Renault Rapid car that is necessary for his business.  The vehicle helps him transport large quantities of fish safely from the wholesale market to his shop.  Amir hopes to expand his business and continue to improve his customer service in the future.

loans.use: To buy a Renault Rapid car to transport large quantities of fish from the wholesale market to his fish shop.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old and married to Patrick.  They have been blessed with six children who are between 4 and 24 years old.  Jacinta runs a general retail shop, earning KES. 30,000 a month.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 10,000.  This is her first loan and she intends to use the entire amount to buy stock of goods like rice, maize flour, and sugar to sell. 

Teresa anticipates using her profits to repay her loan and invest in her business for better returns.  Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business into a supermarket and be able to build her own residential home.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, maize flour, and sugar to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad, who is pictured in the photograph, is a 26-year-old taxi driver from Jabalia Refugee camp. Muhammad was hired by the Taxi agency in the refugee camp and has been working with them for three years now.

Muhammad could save a good amount of money but he needs $1,500 to purchase a taxi car and have a better income than sharing the income with the agency.
