loans.use: To purchase a taxi car

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana comes from the village of Sartichala, Gardabani District. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband, two adult sons and daughter-in-law. Manana’s husband is a worker in the village, mainly in house construction and renovation work.
Manana is heading the family's dairy farm. She has three cows and produces approximately 70kg of Georgian cheese per month. Twice a week Manana takes the cheese to Tbilisi (the capital city) and sells it on the Tbilisi open market. The family's total income is 400 Laris. Though Manana works hard, it is hardly enough to meet the family's daily expenses and they are unable to make savings for investing in the expansion of the farm. Because of this, Manana is requesting credit to purchase one more dairy cow. When she has four cows she will be able to sell approximately 30 per cent more cheese and thus increase the family's income by 15 to 20 per cent.
With the increased income, Manana will purchase household goods/appliances in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nzeyi , membre du groupe d’affaire « Utulivu »,  est entrepreneur, fille d’affaire, âgée de 25 ans, célibataire. Elle est vendeuse des oignons, ails. Elle s’installe dans un dépôt de vente au centre commercial agricole de Birere. Il ya 3 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  4 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  1 sac d’oignons, 3 sacs d’ails.  En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle pour sa famille et y construire aisément.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «Utulivu» est majoritairement féminins et représenté par une jeune fille leader.
texts.en: Nzeyi, who is a member of the Utulivu business group, is a 25 year old business woman and single. She sells onions and garlic. She sets up shop in a vending place in the agricultural commercial centre at Birere. She has been in this business for 3 years. However she has just finished 4 credit cycles with Hekima. This new loan will enable her to buy  stock of 1 sack of onions and 3 sacks of garlic. In addition she hopes to purchase a plot of land for her family and build on it. The client is grateful to Hekima for their activities in favour of poor women who do not have access to classic banking institutions. It should be noted that the Utulivu business group is predominately feminine and represented by a single girl who is the leader.

loans.use: purchase 1 sack of onions and 3 sacks of garlic.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 55-year-old widow.  She has two children whom she supports.  Margaret runs a cosmetics shop in Kisauni, Mombasa and her business has been in operation for six years.

Margaret has been good client of Kiva partner KADET LTD.  This is her second loan to finance her business.  She will use this loan to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.  Margaret will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and meet her family’s needs.  Her dream is to live a happy life and see her children live the best possible lives that she can provide.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Heleine

texts.en:
Heleine is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of three children.  She lives in Tyre.  Heleine has manufactured perfume for eight years and, in 2007, opened her own shop.  Her shop has a very good reputation in her region.  All of her customers recommend her products because they have experienced them.

Heleine requests a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to buy new scents so that she can make her own perfume blends.  This is Heleine's third loan cycle with A. Majmoua.  The previous loans have helped her to achieve most of her goals and she hopes to improve even more.

loans.use: To buy new scents to make her own perfume blends

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer comes from the village of Martkopi, Gardabani District. He is married and lives with his wife Nina, son and mother. Nina works as a teacher in a local school. Vladimer’s son is a joiner and works in his own workshop. Vladimer has a minibus; he drives passengers on the Martkopi – Lilo line. This line is always crowded, because Lilo is a wholesale centre of East Georgia and people from Martkopi and nearby villages often travel there for shopping purposes. Recently, Vladimer’s minibus had some problems and he had to stop work. He needs to repair his minibus in order to continue provision of quality transportation services to villagers.
Vladimer has requested credit to repair his minibus, which is an important source of income for him and his family. A small part of the credit will be used to renovate part of his house.

loans.use: to pay for minibus repairs and materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Kawral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KAWRAL a été créé en juillet 2008 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il est composé de 26 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Néné est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51ans, mariée et est mère de quatre enfants. Elle prend en charge aussi ses trois neveux.

Elle vend du riz, de l’huile végétale et de palme. Elle a  une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué au moins pendant des années.

Ce nouveau lui permettra de s’approvisionner en riz, huile et ognons   pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de son activité, elle compte renforcer son magasin  soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Kawral Group was created in July of 2008 at the inauguration of their village bank.  It is made up of 26 women who are from the same village.  Their primary business is petty trading.  Madam Néné is in charge of the group.  She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She also looks after three nephews. She sells rice, vegetable and palm oil.  She has valuable experience in this area, having practiced this business for many years.

This new loan will allow her to resupply with rice, oil, and onions for resale.  With the profits she reaps from her business, she intends to strengthen her shop and support her husband in sending the children to school.

loans.use: to stock-up on rice, oil, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Twebaze Womens Group

texts.en: Norah is 40 years old and sells beverages, fruit, and vegetables at her grocery store in Mpigi town.  She is a happily married mother of seven.  Norah says that she worked in weaving and making handcrafts before she joined this business. Since becoming involved in the grocery store, she has stopped her weaving and handcrafts work.  Norah is an easygoing, upbeat, hard-working and focused businesswoman. This may just be the stock in trade she needs to open up a better horizon of opportunity for her business in the future. On the side, she ekes out further revenue from a small brick-sales business. She says her business generates profits of 150,000 shillings each month. This loan is to aid her in purchasing more crates of soft drinks and fruit and vegetables to resell at her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, fruit, and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old and married.  She supports a family of three school-going children. Beatrice operates a cereals business in the Kuywa trading centre in Kitale.

She has been in business for the last six years and this has been her only source of income. From this business she gets a profit of KES 4,000 a month. She has applied for a loan of KES 5,000 from KADET LTD to buy more beans for sale.

Beatrice anticipates on using her profits to expand the business and repay the loan. Beatrice dream is to own a milling company and give her family the best life she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase stock of assorted cereals for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a kitchen table and chairs.

loans.name: Wend La Yangda Group

texts.fr:
Mme Kalizeta est la représentante du groupe WEND LA YANGDA. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans le moins âgé a 8 ans. Tous les trois vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes à sa charge.

Mme est coiffeuse et vend parallèlement des sacs à main pour dame. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 9 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur n°10 de Ouagadougou. Ses clients son les femmes.

Mme veut acheter 5 sacs à main et 12 paquets de mèche, 12 paquets de tissage, 6 grosses boites de défrisant, 6 petites boites de défrisant 2 bidons de 4 litre de champoing et 2 bidons de 4 litre de démêlant pour son salon de coiffure.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour aider son mari dans les charges familiales et dans le bon fonctionnement de son salon de coiffure. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique de vente de sacs à main.
texts.en:
Kalizeta is the representative of the WEND LA YANGDA group. She is married with three children. The oldest is sixteen years old the and the youngest is eight. The three of them are attending school and besides she has other four kids in her care.
She is a hairdresser and alongside she sells ladies handbags. She has been in this business for nine years. She purchases her supplies at the market of the 10th district of Ouagadougou. Her customers are exclusively women.
Kalizeta would like to buy 5 handbags, 12 packs of hair extensions,12 packs of hair appliques, 6 large boxes of defrizzing lotion, 6 small boxes of defrizzing treatment, 2 bottles of 4 liter shampoo and 2 bottles of 4 liter hair conditioner for her hair salon.
She will use her profits to help her husband with family care and to improve the service in her salon. Her wish is to open a large handbags store.

loans.use: to purchase five handbags and hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Fitina

texts.fr: La cliente Fitina est entrepreneur, âgée de 38 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants et tous ses enfants étudient. Son mari est un menuisier charpentier.Elle est vendeuse de souliers usés au marché municipal CADECO. Depuis  Bukavu-Sud Kivu,avant qu'elle s'installe à Goma, elle exercait cette activité. Certes,il ya 19 ans révolus qu'elle fait ce commerce. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 3 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima avec ses produits de graduation. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 1 ballon de souliers usés et le reste d’argent sera affecté dans les petits projets de la famille. En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire sa maison. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.La cliente reste très sereine devant sa résidence.
texts.en:
Our customer Fitina is a 38 years old entrepreneur. She is married and a mother of nine children who all go to school. Her husband is a carpenter. She retails second-hand shoes at the Cadeco municipal market.

She has been in the business since she lived in the Bukavu region. In fact, it's been over 19 years that she's been in this business.In addition, she just went through three loan cycles with Hekima's graduated financial products.

This new loan should allow her to build up her stock with one bundle of second-hand shoes; the remainder of the money will be allocated to the family's small projects. In addition to this, she aims to keep her children in school and to build her house. The customer thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banking. The customer is sitting very serenely in front of her habitation.

loans.use: to buy one bundle of second-hand shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Malibongwe Group

texts.en:
Florence Siphiwe is 45 years old and single, with 2 children who are 22 and 27 years old. She runs a clothing business in the Kwa Zulu Natal area of Empangeni in South Africa. She also takes care of her 3 grandchildren.  In the photo she is pictured raising her right arm.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells clothes and jewelry at her home. She also receives income from the goverment's children grant. She explained that her main challenge is customers who do not pay on time after purchasing on credit. Florence Siphiwe requested this loan though WDB and Kiva to buy clothes and jewelry for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her grow her business and improve her family's life.

loans.use: To buy clothes and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and young child. He has owned a small grocery store since 2009, where he sells flour, sugar, tinned foods, etc. He is thankful for his decision to start a business; it allows him to improve his family's financiA. status. With his requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., he will purchase additionA. merchandise for his shop. With these purchases he will be able to increase his sales and therefore his income. In the future, he is planning to also sell vegetables from his shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем, имеет одного ребенка. У нее среднее образование. Уже 12 лет как она работает на рынке. Мавчуда арендует торговую точку, где продает овощи. Кредит берет для покупки картошки, лука и морковки.
texts.en: Mavjuda lives in the town of Khujand. She is 50 years old. She is married, with one child. She has completed secondary education. She has been a marketplace vendor for 12 years. She rents out a stand where she sells vegetables. She is taking out a loan to buy potatoes, onions and carrots.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions and carrots

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 27-year old businessman, married, and the father of two children. He specializes in selling second-hand clothes and his business has been in operation for 11 years. This is his first loan from KADET to buy more clothes for sale. He intends to repay on time and diversify into other market areas in order to support his family. He wants to expand his business and purchase land to provide a better living standard for his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and young child. He has owned a barber shop since 2006 and has ten years of experience working in the same field. He learned this occupation when he was young. He is well known in his town as well as in neighboring villages. The borrower is the only source of income for the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional products and tools needed to continue his work appropriately. He is expecting to further expand his business and he is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and tools.

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah is 27 years old. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. Hanifah has a video library business, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Hanifah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more video DVDs for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Hanifah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more video DVDs for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 41 years old and married to Ruth a shop keeper. They have two children aged 16 and 12 years. He has been running a butchery and a retail shop for the past four years with an income of KES. 10,000 per month which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully. He will use the loan to purchase more stock such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, and maize meal for his retail shop. James will use the anticipated profits  to expand his businesses. His hopes are to own a big wholesale shop, educate his children, and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: To purchase more stock — sugar, rice, and cooking oil, for sale

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka comes from the village of Ksovrisi, Mtskheta District. He is 40 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Lali and two sons (17 and 13 years old), both of whom go to school.
Mamuka is requesting credit to repair his minibus, which is the source of income for the family. He uses it in summer and fall to transport villagers and their fruits/vegetables to the open market in Tbilisi (the capital city). The distance between Ksovrisi and Tbilisi is approximately 35km. Mamuka’s minibus is already old and he needs to change some parts in order for it to function safely and provide comfortable transportation for the villagers.
Mamuka also helps Lali in the family-owned dairy farm. They have four milk cows and sell approximately 100kg Georgian cheese in nearby villages.
A small part of the credit will be used for house renovation. After the renovation family members will have better living conditions and a better spirit for hard work.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his minibus, pay for its repair service and purchase materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 32 years old. He is married and has two children, neither of whom are currently in school. Robert has a business selling charcoal, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further and buy more charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two young children. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as a mechanic for 18 years. In 1998, he opened his own car repair shop specializing in repairing vehicles' bodies. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new mechanicA. tools and supplies to be able to provide his customers with faster, proper services. In the future, he hopes to further enlarge his shop and set aside a small area where he will sell car spare parts. His income is required to help support his wife and two children.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools and supplies.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 48 years old. He is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Denis has a small retail shop, which he has run for five years.
To help expand his business, Denis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Denis hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Pablo Boanerges

texts.es:
Pablo Boanerges tiene 45 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Pablo se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos de plagas y enfermedades como langosta y cogollero. Su sueño es salir adelante.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Pablo Boanerges is 45 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called "Unidos Venceremos" (United We Shall Overcome).  It is located in La América, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Pablo grows crops, especially corn and rice.  He has been doing this for a long time.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas each month and makes his sales in the street market in the same town.

Pablo is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business: plant diseases and pest infestations such as locusts and budworms.  His dream is to get ahead in life.

Pablo enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Okello

texts.en:
Okello is 45 years old. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Okello has a hardware shop, which he has run for five years.
To help expand his business, Okello has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hardware materials for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Okello hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware materials for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 48-year-old businessman. He and his wife Lucy have five children aged between 30 and 12. He has been a blacksmith for the past 18 years with a monthly income of KES. 5,000 to support his family. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by KADET staff. He will use the loan to purchase more scrap metals for his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. His hope is to have a better living standard.

loans.use: To purchase scrap metals

loans.name: Angel Ilario

texts.es:
Angel Ilario tiene 43 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con tres hijos de 19, 16 y 13 años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes en Agripar y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos enfermedades en los cultivos que se llama Orasco. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta hacer deporte en especial en indor.
texts.en:
Ilario Angel, 43, is married and lives with his wife and three children who are aged 19, 16 and 13.   He lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Province of Los Ríos.  

This group is called "UNIDOS VENCEREMOS" (United We Shall Overcome).  It is located in La América, in Ventanas Canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Angel has been working in agriculture for a long time, especially corn and rice.  He makes purchases monthly at Agrippa in Ventanas, and sells in the market in the same town.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and manure. With the support of the loan he will be able to financially cover his needs. He faces the challenge of a crop disease called Orasco. His dream is to buy a car. 

He likes playing sports, especially indoor sports.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 49 years old. She is single and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. Mariam has a business selling food, which she has run for ten years.
To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Nastanzia

texts.en:
Nastanzia is 48 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. Nastanzia has a grocery business selling food, which she has run for ten years.
To help expand her business, Nastanzia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Nastanzia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Thembalethu Group

texts.en:
Zanele, on the left, is 35 years old and single with five children between the ages of 2 and 18. Four of her children attend school. She sells food in Kwa zulu Natal, Empangeni in South Africa. She been in the business for 15 years selling cold drinks, fruits, vegetables and sweets from her home. She also receives income from the goverment's child support program. She says that the main challenge to her business are customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time. Zanele requested this loan throgh WDB Kiva to buy cold drinks, fruits, vegetables and sweets. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her life and pay for her children's school. In future she would like to see her business grow and end up owning a room to sell her products.

She explained that she started borrowing from WBB last year and it has helped her a lot.  She hopes that the partnership with Kiva will make the friendship even better.

loans.use: To buy drinks, fruits, vegetables and sweets

loans.name: Wilton Cristobal

texts.es:
Wilton Cristobal tiene 23 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con unas  hija de cuatro años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Wilton se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos enfermedades como la langosta y diatrea en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar una finca para seguir sebrando.

Le gusta ver la television.
texts.en:
Wilton Cristobal is 23 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and four year old daughter.  He lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Province of Los Ríos.

This group is called "UNIDOS VENCEREMOS" (United We Shall Overcome). It is located in La América, in Ventanas Canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Wilton has been working in agriculture for a long time, especially with corn and rice.  He makes purchases monthly at Agrippa in Ventanas, and sells in the market in the same town.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and manure. With the support of the loan he will be able to financially cover his needs. He faces challenges  of infestations such as locusts and diatrea caterpillars.  His dream is to buy a farm for further sowing.

He likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Jane has a business selling second-hand shoes, which she has run for five years. She also has a second business selling bricks for building houses.
To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Carlos  Segundo

texts.es:
Carlos Segundo tiene 42 años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y construir una casa grande.

Le gusta hacer deporte especialmente correr por las mañanas.
texts.en:
Carlos Segundo is 42 years old.  He is single, and lives with his parents.  He has no children.

This group is called "UNIDOS VENCEREMOS" (United We Shall Overcome). It is located in La América, in Ventanas Canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Carlos has been working in agriculture for a long time, especially corn and rice. He makes purchases monthly at Agrippa in Ventanas, and sells in the market in the same town.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and manure. With the support of the loan he will be able to financially cover his needs. He faces challenges such as crop diseases.  His dream is to buy some land and to build a big house.

He likes to play sports, especially running in the mornings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Robertson

texts.en: Robertson is an enterprising 32-year-old businessman. He is married to Magdalene and they have three children ages 12, eight and four. He has been running a greengrocer business for the past 12 years with a monthly income of KES. 6,000 which he uses to support his family. Robertson is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous ones successfully. He will use the loan to purchase potatoes and tomatoes for his store. With the anticipated profit from the business he plans to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to own a big general shop and educate his children without problems.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Akwata Empola Development Group

texts.en:
45-year-old Florence's decade-long dairy business is what she has depended on to provide better support for her family of six. Milk is in high demand in many parts of Jinja.

Florence herds her own cattle, which is an asset in this business. She says by virtue of the fact that she has her own cows, she in most cases is able to handle the demands of clients.

This business generates Florence an income of 70,000 UGX weekly. She says this loan is to help her purchase another heifer.

loans.use: to purchase another heifer.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 50 years old. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are currently in school. Catherine has a poultry farm business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Catherine has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Catherine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is forty years old and married to Rebecca, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with four children. He has been a miner for the past two years which earns him a monthly income of 2,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

Robert is applying for his sixth loan from KADET LTD after repaying his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy mining tools. Robert will use the anticipated profits to expand his mining area.

Robert’s dream is to have his own tractor.

loans.use: to buy mining tools.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan is 35 years old. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her two children and her husband. 

She and her husband make rubber bands that are used in water pipe construction. She intends to take a loan to purchase a machine and raw materials to increase production.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy machinery and raw materials to make rubber bands

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA D. BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa; ella tiene 56 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. artesanía, ella venD. en el centro artesanal D. la ciudad D. Cusco, también se dedica a la crianza D. cuyes y también venD. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz),ella prepara la chicha y atienD. su pequeño bar desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio D. estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. artesanía y el negocio D. venta D. chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía y también productos para preparar la chicha como maíz y jora.  
                                                         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the "Reynita D. Belen Ccorao" community bank which is located in Ccorao district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Teresa is 56 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling handicrafts.  She makes her sales in the craft center of the city of Cusco.  She also raises guinea pigs and sells 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  She prepares her 'chicha' and serves in her small bar from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  Through her businesses, Teresa gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her handicrafts business and also her 'chicha' business.  She is requesting this loan to buy handicrafts and also supplies for preparing 'chicha' such as corn and 'jora' corn.

Teresa is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts and also supplies for preparing 'chicha' such as corn and 'jora' corn

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is 48 years old and married with three children. He has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver for three years. His wife earns money by raising rabbits at house. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

They would like to take a loan to expand their rabbit rearing business by buying more rabbits to raise and sell.

He hopes that the business of raising and selling rabbits will increase their income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty salon products.

loans.name: Katiusca Roxana

texts.es:
Katiusca Roxana tiene 35 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Katiusca se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos, además le gustaría invertir un poco en la comprar de pollos para criar y vender.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es que siempre tengan salud y vida para seguir trabajando.

Le gusta realizar los trabajos de la casa como limpiar, lavar, además le gusta mucho tener amigos y festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Katiusca Roxana is 35 years old, married and living with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

This communal bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and is located in Cachely Grande which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Katiusca is a farmer, especially of corn, rice and beans.  She does her purchases in the “Hermanos Olivos” supermarket every month and her sales take place in the local farmers market.

She requested the loan to buy seed and manure for her crops.  She’d also like to invest a bit in the purchase of chickens to raise and sell.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are crop illnesses.  

Her dream is that they continue healthy and alive to continue working.  She likes doing housework like cleaning and washing.  She also likes having friends very much and to celebrate the local festivals.

loans.use: to buy seed and manure for her crops and also to invest some in the purchase of chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 38 years old. She is single and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Prossy has a restaurant business, which she has run for ten years.         
To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC. The loan will be used to purchase more food to cook in the restaurant. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook in her restaurant.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is 37 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband helps her to run a cafe that sells food and beverages in the local community. In addition, her husband grows and sells flowers.

She plans to get a loan to invest in and expand her cafe business. 

She and her husband hope that the expansion of their business will enabL. them to earn more income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more beverages and food for her cafe

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in H. Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have worked in farming for 20 years. To earn more money to support her family, she intends to take a loan to buy fertilizer and raise cattle so that they can have more money to cover the cost of family expenses.

She hopes that in the future, she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Phu

texts.en:
Phu is a 46-year-old married man with two children. He lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

He and his wife have had a business weaving fabric at their house for 10 years.

He would like to receive a loan to expand their business by purchasing raw materials. 

He hopes that this will enabL. them to have more capital for their work and enough money to bring up their children.

loans.use: To more weaving materials.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 34 years old. She is single and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Agnes has a small retail shop, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Agnes hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Melania Marlene

texts.es:
Melania Marlene tiene 42 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Melania se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos y la falta de no tener el terreno propio. Su sueño es tner un terreno propio.

Le gusta hacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Melania Marlene is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called "Nuevo Horizonte" (New Horizon) and it is located in Cachely Grande, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, beans and pigeon peas.

Melania grows crops, especially corn, rice and beans.  She makes her purchases in "Hnos. Olivos" store each month and makes her sales in the street market in the same town.

Melania is requesting this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as crop diseases and the fact that she doesn't own her own land.  Her dream is to own her own plot of land.

Melania enjoys taking part in sports together with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cereales, venta de ovejas y crianza de cuyes, la socia vende los cereales en el mercado de Huancaro desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y las ovejas y cuyes lo vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Ccorao,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cereales y también ayuda a su esposo en el trabajo como minero. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para el trabajo de su esposo. 
                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the "Reynita de Belen Ccorao" community bank which is located in Ccorao district, in Cusco province and department.

Hilda is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her businesses selling cereals, selling sheep and raising guinea pigs.  Hilda sells her cereals in Huancaro market form 7.00am to 8.00pm and she sells her sheep and guinea pigs in the different street markets that take place in Ccorao district.  She would like to expand and improve her cereals business and also help her husband in his work as a miner.  She is requesting this loan to buy tools for her husband's work.

Hilda is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's work

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy is 31 years old and married with a son. She lives with her son and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband works in a printing shop. Vy has supported her family by making clothes since 1990. 

She would like to take a loan to buy sewing tools and materials for her business. She hopes that this investment will assist her to meet her customers' needs and increase her income to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools and materials

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 48 years old and married with two children. He works as a motorcycle taxi driver and has done so for 22 years. His wife earns money by selling fried potatoes on T. street. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

He intends to take a loan to buy a new fuel-saving motorcycle that will help him to reduce expenses and get more customers. 

He hopes that this will increase his income and enable him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new fuel-saving motorcycle

loans.name: Jose Douglas

texts.es:
Jose Douglas tiene 37 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con dos hijos de 5 y 4 años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol y un poco en palma africada desde hace 10 años, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos, además le gustaría invertir un poco en cultivar palma africana.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. No enfrenta desafiios muy graves. Su sueño es comprar una casa grande.

Le gusta trabajar y practicare indor.
texts.en:
Jose Douglas is 37 years old, married and living with his wife and two children who are 5 and 4 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

This communal bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and is located in Cachely Grande which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

José has been a farmer, especially of corn, rice and beans and some African Palm for ten years.  He does his purchases in the “Hermanos Olivos” supermarket every month and his sales take place in the local farmers market.

He requested the loan to buy seed and manure for his crops.  He’d also like to invest a bit in the purchase of African Palms to grow.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He isn’t facing any serious challenges.  His dream is to buy a large house.

He enjoys working and playing Indor (type of soccer).

loans.use: to buy seed and manure for his crops and also to invest a bit in African Palm crops.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA D. BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lorenza; ella tiene 61 años D. edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. cereales como trigo, habas y cebada y lo venD. en forma ambulatoria y también tiene un terreno D. cultivo donD. siembra maíz y habas, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. cereales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cereales al por mayor.  
                                                         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the "Reynita D. Belen Ccorao" community bank which is located in Ccorao district, in Cusco province and department.

Lorenza is 61 years old, widowed, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling cereals such as wheat, beans and barley.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor and also owns a plot of land where she grows corn and beans.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Lorenza would like to expand her cereals business.  She is requesting this loan to buy cereals wholesale.

Lorenza is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cereals wholesale

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is 53 years old and married. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City with his wife and son. 

He and his wife have owned a cafe for 10 years. This is the main income source of their family. In addition, he takes people in the local community from place to place as a motorcycle taxi driver using an old motorcycle.  

He requires a loan to repair and upgrade his motorcycle to attract more customers. He hopes this job will bring in extra income to pay for his family's expenses.

loans.use: to repair his old motorcycle

loans.name: Efracia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Efracia; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y entre otros productos, la socia también se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y gallinas y luego los vende en el mercado, por medio de estos pequeños la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes y alimentos para los chanchos y gallinas.    
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Efracia is a member of the "Reynita de Belen Ccorao" community bank which is located in Ccorao district, in Cusco province and department.

Efracia is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, milk, etc.  Efracia also raises pigs and hens which she sells in the market.  Through these small businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.

Efracia would like to expand her grocery store business and her animal business.  She is requesting this loan to buy products for her grocery store and feed for her pigs and hens.

Efracia is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store and feed for her pigs and hens

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
Tat is a 54-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband is retired and she has been selling chicken in a small market for 15 years. 

Her family depends on her business as their primary source of income. She would like to take a loan to buy more chickens to sell in the market so that she can earn more money to cover her family's living expenses.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y de bar, los negocios también es de su mama y juntas trabajan, la socia también trabaja en el sector turismo como administradora de un restaurant  en el distrito de Ollantaytambo que queda a 1 hora y 20 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y bar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos y para implementar el bar.
                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nancy, 27, is a member of the “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank located in Ollantaytambo District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is single.  She alternates her daily chores with running a grocery store and bar.  The businesses are her mother’s also and they work together.  She also works in tourism managing a restaurant in Ollantaytambo District that’s an hour and a half from the city of Cusco.  She wants to expand the grocery store and bar and is asking for a loan to buy stock items for the store like, rice, sugar, milk and noodles, and to equip the bar.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store and to equip the bar.

loans.name: Gerogina Guadalupe

texts.es: Georgina se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de tricitaxi. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo y humildad. Inicio este medio de vida gracias por su esposo ya que juntos han pasado muchos momentos difíciles. Todos los días tiene que realizar las tareas del hogar y esperar a la persona que se encarga de realizar este trabajo todos los días. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, frenos, tapizar asientos y comprar lona y otros productos para proteger a sus clientes del sol.
texts.en: Georgina offers a cycle rickshaw service.  She has owned this business for three years, with a lot of hard work and humility.  She started out in this line of work thanks to her husband.  Together they have been through a lot of difficult times.  Every day, Georgina has to carry out her household chores and wait for the person who is in charge of carrying out this work every day.  Georgina is requesting a loan to buy tires and brakes.  She will also have the seats of her vehicle upholstered and buy a canopy and other products to protect her customers from the sun.

loans.use: to buy tires, brakes and a canopy, and to upholster the seats of her vehicle

loans.name: Bitariho

texts.fr: Bitariho est client d’ACB dépuis 2009, il est marié, il a 45 ans, il a 10 enfants entre 3 mois et 18 ans  et 8 enfants vont à l’école, il a 3 personnes en charge, il est ne  au RDC(République Démocratique du Congo) mais il a nationalite Rwandais.il a niveau  de 3 ans des études secondaire. C’est son quatrième  cycle de  prêt avec ACB, et il n’a aucun difficultés attendus de non-remboursement .Il va utilise le prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de ciments ,30planches de rives, 30 triplex ,2 portes, 10 kgs des clous. Sa stratégie pour la croissance  de l’affaire est augmentée la capacité du busines et investir pour des maisons à louer. Dans l’avenir il voudrait construire d’autres maisons dans les différents milieux, et il voudrait construire des maisons pour ses enfants.il possède aussi un atelier de couture.
texts.en: Bitariho  has been a client of ACB since 2009. He is 45 years old, married,  and has 10 children ranging from three months to 18 years of age. 8 of his children go to school. He has three other dependents. He is born in RDC (the Democratic Republic of Congo), but has Rwandan nationality. He has finished three years of high schools. This is his fourth loan cycle with ACB, and he has had no problems with payment. He will use this loan to buy five bags of cement, 30 fascia boards, 30 triple-ply boards, two doors, and10 kgs of nails.  His business strategy is investing in houses  to rent out. In the future he would like to build  more houses in  various neighborhoods, and also houses for his children. He also owns a tailor’s shop.

loans.use: to buy five bags of cement, 30 fascia boards, 30 triple-ply boards, two doors, and 10 kgs of nails.

loans.name: Ngat

texts.en:
Ngat is 46 years old and married with two daughters and one son. Her husband repairs motorcycles and helps her to run a grocery store at their door.

They have owned the store for 11 years and now she would like to get a loan to invest in her store by buying more stocks of food and beverages. 

She hopes that the business expansion will increase her income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy more food and beverages for her store

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es: El señor Rudy es albañil constructor y su esposa se dedica a labores agrícolas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de calaminas, vigas y puertas, esto para la construcción de una habitación en su casa para tener mayor comodidad. Vive en casa propia en la comunidad de Achacachi a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene un hijo. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rudy works as a bricklayer in construction, his wife is a farmer.  He needs the loan to buy plywood, beams and doors to add a room onto his house in order to be more comfortable.  

He lives in his own house in Achacachi, two hours from the city of La Paz.  He’s married and has a son.  This is his first loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 43 years old and married with a daughter. Her husband is a worker in a local factory. She supports her family by weaving thread and fibers at her house. 

She plans to get a loan to invest capital in her business to increase production and buy more raw materials in bulk at cheaper prices.  

She hopes that the loan will enabL. her business to generate a higher income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials in bulk

loans.name: Mariela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mariela Elizabeth tiene 27 años, es madre soltera, vive con los padres y con el hijo de cuatro años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul y cria

Mariela se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos los engorda y los vende, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Ercopa" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mas animales y alimentacion para los mismos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar no tener granja propia por es arrendada. Su sueño es auentar la produccion y tener mas animales.

Le gusta ver television.
texts.en:
Mariela Elizabeth, 27, is a single mother living with her parents and her 4-year-old son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

This communal bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and is located I Cachely Grande belonging to Ventanas Canton.  The members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers and raise livestock.

Mariela raises chickens and pigs; she fattens them up for sale.  She makes her purchases at “Ercopa” suppliers each month and sells at the local farmers market.

She is requesting the loan to buy more animals and feed for them.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenge she faces is not having a farm of her own; she leases.  

Her dream is to increase production and have more animals.  She enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Diego Manuel

texts.es: Diego Manuel es un hombre muy trabajador, el tiene su negocio que es la venta de golosinas, tajaditas y eskimos esta no es la primera vez que Diego realiza un financiamiento para su negocio. Esto le ha permitido ampliar su inventario para ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad en golosinas y otros productos. El tiene que levantarse temprano para llegar a las afueras del colegio a vender. Este crédito es para la compra de caramelos, bombones, chicles, galletas, tajaditas y eskimos.
texts.en: Diego Manuel is a very hard-working man who owns a business selling candies, plantain chips and 'eskimos' (a brand of iced treats).  This is not the first time that Diego has taken out a loan for his business.  Loans have enabled him to expand his inventory so that he can offer his customers a range of candies and other products.  Diego has to get up early in order to reach the spot outside the high school where he sells his products  He will use this loan to buy candies, chocolates, gum, cookies, plantain slices and 'eskimos'.

loans.use: to buy candy, chocolates, gum, cookies, plantain chips and 'eskimos' (a brand of iced treats)

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 51-year-old married woman. She lives with two sons and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband supports the family by working in construction. Anh supports the family by running a cafe at her door, which she has done for the past seven years. She intends to take a loan to invest capital in her business by upgrading her cafe/home and purchasing stock. 

She hopes that the loan will enable her to generate more income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy more beverages for resale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es chofer propietario de un Minibús y su esposa trabaja como ayudante en el minibús. El crédito lo requiere para e  mantenimiento del motor de su movilidad. 
Antonio vive en la zona de Río Seco de la ciudad de El Alto en casa propia. Está casado pero aún no tienen hijos con su esposa.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de  IMPRO a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Antonio owns a minibus that he drives and his wife’s his assistant.  He needs the loan to service the vehicle’s engine.

Antonio lives in El Alto’s Río Seco zone in his own house.  He’s married but does not have children with his wife yet.

This is the first time he’s asked IMPRO for a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to service his minibus.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is a 50-year-old married woman with two sons and a daughter. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her family has earned a living by renting furniture for the past 37 years. This business is the only income source of her family. 

She intends to take a loan to buy chicken and fish that she will then resell in a small local market. She hopes this will provide the family with an extra regular income source to sustain their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens and fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy phone booths to install in his liquor store to increase his income.

loans.name: Edwin Raul

texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán, which is located on the border of Ecuador and Colombia. He lives with his mother and his two children, a daughter who is five and a son, seven. Edwin is a responsible father who cares about his family's well-being.

Edwin has a small crop of potatoes near his house. He is seeking his first loan to buy fertilizer so he can improve his crops’ yield. He began growing potatoes because his father was a farmer, and from a young age Edwin learned to work in the same way. He has knowledge of the countryside and how to grow crops because he learned from his father.

Edwin wants this loan to educate his two children so that their future lives will be bright. He wants them to "be professionals and serve society."

In the photo, Edwin is in his fields with his animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his potato crops.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Manuel Yubiny

texts.es:
Manuel, es casado y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad con su esposa, él se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de primera necesidad, también atiende la agricultura, con estos trabajos el recibe lo necesario para subsistir con su familia.
Por el momento Manuel iniciara el cultivo de maíz, para esto solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos como abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, estos materiales son los básicos para iniciar el proceso del cultivo, por lo que significa mucho el tenerlo a tiempo para iniciar correctamente el proceso.
Su objetivo es tener un trabajo estable que le ayude a tener una mejor solvencia económica y le garantice a su familia una mejor condición de vida, más que todo a su hija quien dentro de poco iniciara sus estudios.
texts.en:
Manuel is married and has a 5-year-old daughter.  He sells clothes and basic need items but is also a farmer.  He earns enough with these jobs to subsist with his family.

For the moment, Manuel will begin to plant corn.  He needs a loan to buy supplies like manure, fertilizer and insecticide.  These supplies are basic to start the planting process which is why it’s so important to have them at hand on time to start the process correctly.

His objective is to have stable work that will help him have economic solvency and guarantee his family better living conditions, above all for his daughter who will soon start school.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: Maria Gabriela se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 7 años de experiencia en su negocio, siempre ha sido una joven emprendedora que le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia. Inicio por su Mama quien le enseño esta actividad para que Maria en un futuro pudiera salir adelante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra  de pantalones, camisas, faldas, calzado, ropa interior y otros.
texts.en:
María Gabriela sells general merchandise.  She has over 7 years experience in this business.  She’s always been an enterprising young woman who has liked to work to support her family.  

She started thanks to her mother who taught her this line of work so that María would be able to get ahead in the future.  The reason for the loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, footwear, underwear and others.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, footwear, underwear and others.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El señor Manuel es director de música en un grupo de música tropical. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un órgano sintetizador, una guitarra electrica para renovar sus aparatos, pues se encuentra en proceso de  grabación de nuevos temas musicales. Vive en alquiler vive en la zona 12 de octubre en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene un hijo. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Manuel is musical director of a tropical music band.  He needs the loan to buy a synthesizing organ and an electric guitar to renovate his instruments because he’s in the process of recording new musical numbers.

He rents his house in the city of La Paz’s 12 de Octubre zone.  He’s married and has a son.  This is his first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of musical instruments for the band he leads.

loans.name: Renato Geovanny

texts.es:
Renato Geovanny tiene 32 años, es casada vive con la esposa y con la hija. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Renato se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol desde hace 5 años, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos, Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios.

Le gusta jugar bolibool.
texts.en:
Renato Geovanny is 32 years old, married and is living with his wife and daughter in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

This communal bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and is located in Cachely Grande belonging to Ventanas Canton.  The members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Renato has been a farmer, especially of corn, rice and beans for the last five years.  He makes his purchases at the “Hermanos Olivos” supply center each month and sells in the local farmers market.

He is asking for the loan to buy seed and manure for the crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  His dream is to own fields.  He enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seed and manure.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan Pablo se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas y maletas; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: tela, botones, bordados, etc. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de El Rosario en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente ya que pudo aumentar capital de trabajo. Esta es la segunda vez que el crédito es a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo makes backpacks and suitcases.  He needs the loan to buy raw materials like fabric, buttons, and embroidery, etc.

He lives in his parents’ house, which is in the El Rosario area in the city of La Paz.  He is single, and he does not have children.

He is very pleased with the previous loans he was given because he was able to increase his working capital.  This is his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, zippers and embroidery for his business of making backpacks and suitcases.

loans.name: Delmy Esperanza

texts.es:
Delmy, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 11, 16 y 18 años de edad; Ella es ama de casa y realiza también actividades agrícolas, tiene 10 años de estar sembrando maíz, sus hijos mayores le ayudan a este trabajo, el horario que dedican es de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos y tratamientos para plagas, con estos materiales iniciara el proceso de siembra, esperando dar un buen cuido y que pueda recibir una sana cosecha.
Su objetivo es tener una fuente de ingreso, por eso se esfuerza a realizar su trabajo, y velar por que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Delmy is a single mother of three children who are 11, 16 and 18 years of age.  She is a housewife and also farms.  She’s been farming corn for ten years.  Her older children help her with the work.  Their work schedule is 6am to 3pm.

She is asking for a loan to buy manure and insecticide.  She will be able to start planting with these supplies hoping to provide good care so that she can reap a healthy harvest.

Her goal is to have a strong source of income and this is why she strives to do her work and to see to her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía en la ciudadela de Machupicchu,ella vende mochilas,maletines,telares e individuales, la socia también hace trabajos en hilos y lo vende en forma independiente, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.   
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Valentina, 47, is a member of the “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank located in Ollantaytambo District belonging to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling crafts in Machu Picchu.  She sells backpacks, satchels, textiles.  She also makes woven items that she sells independently.  She supports her children with this business.  She wants to expand the crafts sales and is asking for a loan to buy crafts at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts at wholesale.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, es soltero, vive con su madre, se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y res, tiene 3 años de dedicarse al destazo, dos veces por semana, su horario es de 4:00am a 9:00am, él aprendió de su abuelo, a destazar cerdos y reces, para comercializar la carne.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y una vaca, estos los necesita para destazarlos y comercializar su carne, con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de aumentar sus su negocio, teniendo más animales para el destazo.
Su objetivo es hacer crecer el negocio y ayudar a su madre, en todos sus gastos, también superarse económicamente.
texts.en:
Oscar is single, and he lives with his mother.  He sells pork and beef.  He has been a butcher for three years.  He does this twice a week, and his schedule is from 4:00 a.m. until 9:00 a.m.  He learned from his grandfather how to butcher pigs and cows in order to sell the meat.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs and one cow.  He needs them to butcher and sell for their meat.  With this loan he will have the opportunity to increase his business because he will have more animals to butcher.

His objective is to make his business grow and to help his mother with all of the expenses.  He also wants to be financially successful.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a cow to butcher.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Apolinar; el tiene 52 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía en el distrito de Ollantaytambo y también el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, el vende en las distintas ferias que existe en la distrito de Ollantaytambo, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de ganados y mejorar el negocio de artesanía. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como mochilas, polos, chalinas y telares artesanales y comprar alimentos para los ganados.
                                                    
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Apolinar, 52, is a member of the “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank located in Ollantaytambo District belonging to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

He is married and has three children.  He alternates his daily chores with a business selling crafts in Ollantaytambo District; he’s also a livestock merchant selling it in the various farmers markets that are in Ollantaytambo.  He wants to expand the livestock business and improve the crafts business.

He requests the loan to buy crafts like backpacks, polo shirts, shawls and artisanal textiles and to buy feed for the livestock.

He is happy with the loan and committed to pay his installments.

loans.use: to buy crafts and animal feed.

loans.name: Sara Noemi

texts.es: La señorita Sara tiene 23 años, es natural de Lima, soltera y esta cursando estudios de Derecho en la Universidad Cesar Vallejo, actualmente realiza practicas en un Estudio Juridico. Su deseo es graduarse como Abogada e instalar una notaria en el pueblo de donde ella es. Elprestamo lo invertira para pagar un Diplomado y un Congreso con relacion a su carrera.
texts.en: Miss Sara is 23 years old and was born in Lima.  She is single and is studying law at Cesar Vallejo University.  She is currently an intern at a law firm. Her wish is to graduate as a lawyer and to set up as a notary in the town where she lives.  The loan will be used to pay for completing her Diploma and attending a conference related to her career.

loans.use: to pay for completing her diploma and attending a conference

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es: José Benito se dedica a la venta y elaboración de bloques. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, pues es aquí donde obtiene más espacio para la elaboración de sus productos y además es un lugar muy concurrido por sus clientes. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cemento, piedrín, hierro, arena, perlines ladrillos y otros. Siempre se ha esforzado por brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios,  José ha sido un gran padre al proporcionarles a sus hijos los estudios necesarios.
texts.en: José Benito is engaged in the sale and production of cinder blocks. His business is located in his home, as this is where he can get more space for the production of his products.  It is also a popular place for his customers. The reason for the loan is to purchase cement, gravel, iron, sand, bricks and other items. He has always striven to provide his family with the necessary income.  Jose has been a great father, providing his children with the necessary education.

loans.use: to purchase cement, gravel, iron, sand, bricks and other items.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es: La señora Valeriana realiza la venta de ají y su esposo es chofer. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital pues adquirirá mayor cantidad de ají ya que tiene mucha demanda. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene tres hijos. La cliente se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo mejorar y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Esta es la cuarta vez que el préstamo es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Señora Valeriana sells hot peppers and her husband is a driver. The loan is required to increase her capital in order to acquire more hot peppers, as there is high demand. She lives in her own house located in the Alto Irpavi area in the city of La Paz.  She is married and has three children. The client is very satisfied about the potential loan, since it could improve and increase her working capital. This is her fourth time submitting a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy hot peppers at wholesale to sell to her customers.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y entusiasta. Ella es docente y subdirectora del colegio Ane Fran en la comunidad Palo quemado, además es maestra popular y una excelente clienta.
