Madame Adama (au milieux du groupe, légèrement à droite et mise en médaillon) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 27 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle prend aussi en charge aussi sa coépouse.

Elle gère une boutique et vend des légumes activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de deux ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en légume.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront d’acheter des légumes pour la revente et divers marchandises pour la boutique.
texts.en:
Missira Samba is a group that was created on December 6 when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. The group is comprised of 28 women who all live in the same village. They all have small-scale businesses. Ms. Adama (in the middle-right of the group in the photo and appearing in the cameo) is the group’s official. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She also supports her co-wife. 

Ms. Adama runs a shop and sells vegetables. This is a business she has operated for two years. Her new loan will enable her to stock up on vegetables. The profit from this business will allow her to buy vegetables for resale and various merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: to enable her to stock up on vegetables

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo  2 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Yaquelin is the coordinator of her group, Cristo y Nuestro Esfuerzo 2 & 5 (Christ and Our Effort). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and one of their 2 children. She says that her most important challenge is saving enough money to buy a house. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying and attending Church.

Yaquelin is excited to be taking a 7th loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around three and a half years, starting with a some money she saved. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes for sale in her house and by walking around in the community and selling it. She will save the profits, because through this business she wants to make her dream come true, which is to have her own house.

Yaquelin's group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una madre de de familia de 23 años, vive con su esposo e hija en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  La zona se caracteriza por la agricultura y ganadería.
Elena se dedica desde hace 8 meses  a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, negocio que ha instalado en su domicilio, pero también ofrece de casa en casa, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.
Elena ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más productos de belleza para tener en stok y poderles ofrecer a sus clientes.  Elena desea tener en un futuro un negocio más grande donde pueda ofrecer no solo cosméticos sino también ropa y accesorios femeninos, con la finalidad de que su familia se supere y mejore económicamente.
texts.en:
Elena is 23 year old mother. She lives with her husband and daughter in their own home, which has water and electricity, located in the district of Olmos in the department of Lambayeque. 

She engages in selling products by catalogue and on request, and every day she sells her products to her neighbors and friends. Elena has been running this activity for 8 months in her house and in the vicinities of her area, where she can count on recurrent customers. With the income from this activity she can pay for the household expenses. 

Elena is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of more beauty products to have in stock and offer to her clients. In the future, she would like to have a bigger business where she can offer not only cosmetics but also clothes and feminine accessories as well so that her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario tiene 41 años de edad ella reside en casa de su madre, vive allí con su  esposo e hijos, dicha está ubicada en la misma ciudad de Chepen, en el departamento de La Libertad. 

Maria del rosario cuenta con pequeña puesto de ventas instalado en una avenida comercial de la ciudad de Chepen, este negocio es atendido por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes de la zona diversos productos comestibles como golosinas y gaseosas, entre otros productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María del Rosario ha venido experimentando una fuerte demanda en su negocio, debido a esto María Rosario piensa ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles, para lograr sus objetivos.

María Rosario es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen la consideran alguien tranquila y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
María del Rosario is 41 years old. She lives in her mother’s house with her husband and her children. They live in Chepén, a town of the La Libertad department.

María del Rosario owns a small stall located along a business street in the town of Chepén, and she works there alone. She sells various edible products to her customers, such as fizzy drinks and sweets, as well as basic necessities and groceries. The shop is very well-received, and thanks to this activity she can help her husband to financially support their family.

As a result of the growing demand that María del Rosario's shop has been experiencing, she is considering expanding it by buying more products. This is why she has seen it fit to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1800 PEN that she will use to reach her goals.

María del Rosario is a fairly known and respected woman in the communities of the area where she lives. People who know her consider her to be calm and fairly responsible.

loans.use: To buy products to expand her activity.

loans.name: Narciso Natividad

texts.es:
Narcizo tiene 55 años de edad el cuenta con casa propia, la cual está ubicada en una zona rural en un pueblo llamado San Pedro de Lloc, en la provincia de Pacasmayo, La Libertad.

Narcizo se dedica la venta de ceviche, el tiene un puesto de ventas en una de las principales calles del mercado de San Pedro de Lloc el tiene varios años en este negocio y en este tiempo a adquirido experiencia en el rubro, además Narcizo cuenta con muy buena acogida y con clientela fidelizada a su negocio.

Narcizo está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar mobiliario para su negocio como sillas y mesas, de esta manera sus clientes contaran con mayor comodidad al momento de recurrir a su negocio.

Narcizo es una persona bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Narcizo is 55 years old and he owns his own home which is located in a rural region, in a village called San Pedro de Lloc, in the province of Pacasmayo in La Libertad.

Narcizo sells ceviche (a popular seafood dish). He has a stand on one of the main streets of the market in San Pedro de Lloc. He has had this business for many years and during that time he acquired experience in the field. Additionally, Narcizo enjoys a good reputation and he has a loyal client base for his business.

Narcizo requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles to purchase furnishings for his business, such as tables and chairs. This way his clients will enjoy greater comfort when they patronize his business. 

Narcizo is a very hardworking person and he struggles every day to move forward and to have a better quality of life. Those that know him consider him to be a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to purchase furnishings for his business, such as tables and chairs.

loans.name: Saresouna Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 12 Juillet 2008. Il compte 40 femmes qui habitent toutes la même localité. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.

Moumini(debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, mariée, elle prend en charge 11 membres de sa famille. 

Elle vend des condiments du sucre et du thé, activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de deux ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner thé et sucre pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront d’acheter des d la revente et divers marchandises pour la boutique.
texts.en: This group was created on July 12, 2008. It comprises 40 women who all live in the same town. They all have small-scale businesses. Moumini (standing second from the right toward the left) is the group’s official. She is 39 years old and married, plus she has eleven family members to support. Moumini sells condiments, sugar, and tea. This is a business she has been operating for two years. Her new loan will enable her to stock up on tea and sugar to be sold. The profits from this business will allow her to purchase resale items and various merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: to buy tea and sugar

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora una mujer entusiasta de 41 años, reside en el caserío de Llanco. Ahí vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, donde cuida y educa con mucho amor y cariño. Como mujer emprendedora, ella se siente orgullosa de poder ser la cabeza de su familia. La mayor parte de sus días la pasa cuidando a sus hijos y trabajando en su terreno donde siembra papa y verduras, por lo que tiene 20 años realizando la misma tarea. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver como se desarrollan sus frutos, de ello depende para vender toda  la producción, que normalmente los ofrece en el mercado de su ciudad. Como mujer trabajadora administra muy bien su dinero, pues su meta es  comprar hectáreas de tierras para poder sembrar papa y verduras, así tendrá como abastecer a sus clientes que normalmente tiene en la capital, ya que es ahí donde viaja a ofrecer su producción. Actualmente esta llevando técnicas para aumentar sus ventas. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda cumplir con su propósito de comprar terrenos agrícolas y así obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan brindarles a sus hijos la calidad de vida que se merecen. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los ángeles de llanco” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nora de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos, y así obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Nora is an enthusastic 41 year old woman.  She lives in Llanco, a rural community.  She lives with her husband and their four children in her own house.  That is where she raises and educates her children with a lot of love and affection.  As an enterprising woman, she is proud to be able to be the head of her family.  She spends the greater part of the day taking care of her children and working her land.  She has been growing potatoes and vegetables for 20 years.

What she likes the most about her work is being able to see how the plants develop.  Selling all of her productions depends upon the growth of her plants.  She usually sells in the market in her city.  As a hard-working woman, she manages her money very well.  

Her goal is to buy hectares of land in order to be able to plant potatoes and vegetables.  That way she will have stock for the customers she usually has in the capital.  That is where she travels to sell her production.  She is currently employing techniques to increase her sales.  Therefore, she hopes for support from each one of you so that she can carry out her proposal of buying farmland.  That way she will get greater income, which will allow her to provide her children with the quality of life that they deserve.

She belongs to the Los Ángeles de Llanco Communal Bank.  This is her seventh loan with MFP.  She hopes to get a small loan in order to meet her objectives.  She pledges, once again, to make all of her payments as she has done with the previous loans she has had.  It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She will use the requested money to buy sacks of organic fertilizer to spread amongst her plants.  That way she will get a good production.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Oscar Tomas

texts.es: El señor Oscar tiene  51 años, es casado. El señor se dedica a brindar sus servicios como fontanería, electricidad y mantenimiento de líneas telefónicas. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre lo buscan para que realice sus trabajos.  Tiene 30 años de ejercer esta profesión a pesar de que no es fácil ha sabido aprovecharlo, ya que tiene que proporcionarle a su esposa los ingresos necesario. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de herramientas, alambres, pinzas, destornilladores entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 51 years old and married.  He provides plumbing, electrical, and maintenance of telephone lines services.  Most of his customers look for him to do their work.  

He has been in this profession for 30 years.  In spite of the fact that it is not easy, he has known how to make it work.  He has to provide his wife with the necessary income.

The reason for the loan is to buy tools, wire, pincers, and screwdrivers, among other products.

loans.use: to buy tools, wire, pincers, and screwdrivers, among other products.

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Viviano de 38 años, reside en el caserío de Llanco; ahí formó su familia junto a  su esposa y sus 2 hijas a las que quiere con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia. Desde muy niño sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, le gustaba ver como crecían y maduraban; su experiencia de 20 años en la agricultura le ayudó a conseguir muchas cosas como su casa en la que hoy vive muy feliz. Ahora se dedica a la siembra de papa y arveja en un terreno que alquila en el pueblo de Jachapata, donde pasa la mayor parte del día ya que tiene que cuidar su cosecha de las plaga de insectos que en este tiempo están asolando su siembra. Viviano se propuso una meta para este año, juntar capital para poder comprar su propio terreno en Llanco y estar más tiempo con su familia; ya le falta muy poco. Por otro lado en la última cosecha de arveja, obtuvo un rendimiento de 40 sacos de producción que le brindaron buenas ganancias y que le están permitiendo ahorrar para el futuro. Él agradece el apoyo de su banco comunal, ya que le enseñaron a seguir adelante a pesar de las dificultades. “Trabajo constantemente para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a mis hijos”, menciona con orgullo; “La mayor parte de mi ganancia lo invierto en ellos”, finaliza. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los ángeles de Llanco” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Viviano de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 8 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “andina”, que cuesta un promedio de S/. 40 soles cada saco. Asimismo 6 sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre su sembrío y de esa manera obtenga un buen fruto.
texts.en:
Viviano is 38 years old, and he lives in Llanco, a rural community.  That is where he lives in his own house with his family, his wife and his two daughters that he loves a lot.

When he was a very young boy his parents taught him how to work the land.  He liked seeing how the plants grew and matured.  His 20 years of experience helped him to obtain many things like the house in which he now very happily lives.

He now grows potatoes and peas on land that he rents in the village of Jachapata.  He spends most of his day there.  He needs to take care of his crops so that do not have insect infestations, which at this time continue to plaque his crops.   

Viviano has set a goal for this year.  It is to get together money to be able to buy his own land in Llanco and to spend more time with his family.  He now needs very little.  The last pea harvest yielded 40 sacks, which provided him with good earnings and is allowing him to save for the future.

He is grateful for the support of his communal bank because they taught him how to get ahead in spite of the difficulties.  “I work constantly in order to be able to provide my children with a better quality of life,” he says proudly.  He finishes by saying, “I invest most of my earnings in them.”

He belongs to the Los Ángeles de Llanco Communal Bank.  This is his eighth loan with MFP.  He hopes to have their collaboration in order to meet his objectives.  He pledges, once more, to make his payments as he has done with his previous loans.  It pleases him to be part of his communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Viviano will use the requested money to buy eight sacks of Andean potato seeds, which cost an average of S/. 40 per sack.  He will also buy six sacks of organic fertilizer to spread amongst his plants.  That way he will obtain good results.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of potato seeds and six sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer, a printer and wireless phones

loans.name: Mafi

texts.en:
Mafi is 44 years of age and married with four children. Mafi owns & operates a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  She has many years of experience in this business.  Mafi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Mafi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mafi's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en:
Leafa is 50 years of age and married with six children. Leafa owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Leafa needs a loan of WST $1450 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Leafa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Leafa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es: Rosenda, de 34 años reside en el caserío de Llanco. Ahí formó su familia junto a Hugo, de 44 años. Ambos tienen 6 hermosos hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos en su casa propia. Como una mujer responsable y cabeza de su familia, ella sale adelante con la actividad que desde niña le enseñaron. La agricultura, es su principal soporte económico y donde espera lograr sus objetivos trazados. Desde hace 10 años comenzó a sembrar papa y arveja en sus terrenos agrícolas, vendiendo la cosecha a un buen precio en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Asimismo se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de verduras a la ciudad de Pichanaki (selva central peruana), donde viaja 2 veces a la semana para poder vender los productos propios de la sierra a un buen precio. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como peón en la construcción del servicio eléctrico de su comunidad. Por eso Rosenda se encarga de los cuidados de sus sembríos y de sus hijos. Su objetivo es ahorrar y poder sembrar 100 kilos de papa y arveja y con ello tener aumentar su producción y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los ángeles de Llanco” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Rosenda de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios kilos de verduras y hortalizas para su negocio de compra y venta.
texts.en:
Rosenda is 34 years old and lives in the small village of Llanco.  There she formed a family together with 44 year-old Hugo.  They have six beautiful children but only live with four of them in their own home.

As a responsible woman and head of her family, Rosenda gets ahead in the business activity that she was taught as a girl.  Farming is her main financial support and the field in which she hopes to achieve her goals.  For 10 years, she has been growing potatoes and peas on her farm land, selling her harvests for a good price in the wholesale market in Tarma.

Rosenda also buys and sells vegetables in the town of Pichanaki (in the central Peruvian jungle).  She travels there twice a week to sell products from the mountains at a good price.  In addition, she receives support from her husband who is working as a laborer in the setting up of an electricity service in her community.  This means that Rosenda is in charge of looking after her crops and the children.  Rosenda's goal is to save some money and to sow 100 kilos of potatoes and peas.  In this way, she will increase her production and be able to provide her children with a better quality of life.

Rosenda is a member of the "Los Ángeles de Llanco" (The Angels of Llanco) community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation in realizing her plans.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Rosenda enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Rosenda will invest the loan she has requested in buying several kilos of greens and vegetables for her sales business.

loans.use: to buy kilos of greens and vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Naotala

texts.en:
Naotala is 47 years of age and married with seven children. Naotala owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Naotala needs a loan of WST $2900 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2007, Naotala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Naotala's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 28 años  reside en el caserío de Llanco; ahí formó su familia junto a Jorge de 32 años, su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos y a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en una casa alquilada. La principal actividad económica de la zona es la agricultura, desde niña aprendió a trabajar la tierra y vivir de ella. Desde entonces trabajó sembrando arvejas, papa y flores, en un terreno alquilado; ya son 5 años que se dedica a la agricultura y está muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que viaja constantemente a la capital para vender las verduras que siembra durante el año. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder desarrollar los conocimientos adquiridos de parte de sus padres. Por tal sembrará flores y papa ya que es la temporada donde tiene mayor demanda, “se invierte poco y se gana mucho”, afirma.  Además de tener apoyo de parte de su esposo quien trabaja todos los días en una empresa de la zona. Asimismo Elizabeth se dedica también al cuidado de sus hijos, y por ello trabaja para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a ellos. Por eso está juntando dinero para poder comprar su propio terreno y extender la siembra, así logrará ganar más y comprarse una pequeña casa para su familia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los ángeles de Llanco” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Elizabeth de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja que sembrará dentro de poco en terrenos con regadillo. Asimismo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old and lives in the small village of Llanco.  There she formed her family together with her husband, 32 year-old Jorge.  They have three children who they care for with a lot of love and affection.  They live in a rented house.

The main business activity in this area is farming.  Elizabeth learned to work and live off the land when she was a young girl.  Since then she has worked growing peas, potatoes and flowers on a plot of land which she rents.  She has been working in agriculture for five years and is very happy with her work since she is always traveling to the capital city to sell the vegetables that she grows throughout the year.  What she most enjoys about her work is being able to further develop the knowledge that she gained from her parents.

Elizabeth is going to sow flowers and potatoes since this is the season where there is most demand.  "You invest a little and earn a lot" she tells us.  Elizabeth has the support of her husband who works every day for a company in the area.  Elizabeth also looks after her children and she works to provide them with a better quality of life.  Elizabeth is saving up so that she can buy her own plot of land and extend her sowing.  In this way, she will earn more and be able to buy a small home for her family.

Elizabeth is a member of the "Los Ángeles de Llanco" community bank and this is her first loan with MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  Elizabeth enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.

With your support, Elizabeth will invest the money she is requesting in buying two bags of pea seeds that she will sow soon on irrigated land.  She will also buy several sacks of organic manure and natural fertilizers so that she can give her crops a successful start.

loans.use: to buy bags of pea seeds and several sacks of organic manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 38 años de edad, el es casado, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son dependientes, julio cuenta con casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el  caserío Annape,  ubicado  a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope.  

Julio se dedica ala crianza y comercialición de animales, los cuales cría  en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, alimenta sus animales con pastos naturales, maíz, polvillo, etc y cuando estos alcanzan esl peso y tamaño ideal los negocia quincenalmente en Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Su esposa lo ayuda vendiendo verduras y pescado.

Julio está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles el cual utilizará para invertirlo en compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y en compra de verduras y pescado para negociar.
 
Julio es una persona  bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Julio is 38 years old, married and has two children, who are currently dependent. Julio has his own home which is located in the hamlet of Annape located 15 minutes from the city of Mórrope.

Julio works raising and selling animals which he raises in pens located in the back part of his residence. He feeds his animals with natural grasses, corn, powered foods, etc, and once they reach the ideal size and weight he negotiates their sale every other week in Chiclayo and Lambayeque. His wife helps him selling produce and fish. 

Julio is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3,000 Peruvian soles which he will use to invest in purchasing commercially prepared feed for his animals and buying produce and fish for sale. 

Julio is quite a hardworking person and of very good character. Those who know him have a great deal of respect and affection for him.

loans.use: to purchase commercially prepared feed for his animals.

loans.name: G.s. El Buen Corazon Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario El Buen Corazón está conformado por Noelia, José Alberto y Lesbia.  Noelia tiene su negocio que es la venta de ropa, desde hace más de 2 años que tiene esta actividad, que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado obtener. Es una mujer muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan con las diferentes prendas. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior entre otras.
texts.en: "El Buen Corazón" (The Good Heart) community bank has three members: Noelia, José Alberto and Lesbia.  Noelia has a business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for more than two years and obtained it with a lot of sacrifice.  She is a very responsible woman and always pays attention to which different types of clothes her customers are requesting.  She is requesting this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 41 años de edad vive con sus esposa y sus dos hijos. Eugenio cuentan casa propia, la cual está ubicada en un caserío llamado Huascar, en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura, al norte del Perú

Eugenio se dedica a  la crianza de ganado ovino, además cuenta con 1 hectárea  de terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia, la cual está sembrada de limón todo en producción, que cosecha semanalmente, su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral ambos se apoyan, existe una buena relación familiar para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Eugenio está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles dinero que será destinado para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ovinos, además para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y realizar labores de deshierbo para logra una mejor producción y así logra un mejor precio de sus animales y limón, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio. 

Eugenio es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen la consideran alguien tranquila y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 41 years of age and lives with his wife and two children. Eugenio has his own home which is located in a hamlet called Huascar in the district of Tamborgrande in Piura in the northern part of Perú. 

Eugenio works raising sheep and he also has one hectare of farm land which his father has given him as an inheritance. The land is used entirely for producing limes which are harvested weekly. His wife works raising poultry. Both help each other; there is a good family relationship for him to continue growing in his business. 

Eugenio is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 Peruvian soles, money which will be used for buying commercial feed for fattening sheep. Additionally he will buy fertilizers for growing limes and pay labor costs for weeding, in order to achieve better yields and thus get a better price for his animals and limes. This investment will allow him to continue to grow in his business. 

Eugenio is very well known and respected by the inhabitants of the area where he lives. The people who know him consider him to be easygoing and quite responsible.

loans.use: to purchase commercial feed for his animals and fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Ioka

texts.en:
Ioka is 21 years of age and she is a married woman with no kids. Ioka owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 6 years of experience in this business. Ioka needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 258 talas or US $108 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Ioka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ioka's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jonathan, de 21 años reside en el caserío de Llanco. Donde es un ejemplar hijo, que lucha ante las adversidades sin miedo, ya que ayuda a sus padres en los gastos del hogar. A pesar de su corta edad, saca provecho de su fuerza y vitalidad; el cual le permite dedicarse a varias actividades. En las mañanas trabaja como peón en una fabrica de su localidad, donde pasa la mayor parte del día; ahí recibe un salario mensual muy bueno que le permite tener la seguridad económica que necesita para poder seguir con sus negocios; “el trabajo en la empresa no es estable”, afirma con nostalgia; “por ello tengo que aprovechar al máximo”. Asimismo por las tardes se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes, pero la actividad que más le agrada a Jonathan es la agricultura, donde siembra arveja y papa en el terreno de sus padres, hace ya 5 años. Las ganancias obtenidas en la venta de las arverjas le permitieron abastecer su tienda con más productos, ahora está juntando capital para poder abrir una tienda de abarrotes en el pueblo de Huasahuasi. Ahora todas sus fuerzas se concentran en salir adelante y aprovechar las oportunidades que la vida le da, para poder ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los ángeles de Llanco” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Jonathan de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 21 years old and lives in the small village of Llanco.  He is an exemplary son who fights adversity without fear.  He helps his parents with their household expenses.  In spite of his young age, Jonathan makes the most of his strength and vitality which allows him to work in several business activities.

In the mornings, Jonathan works as a laborer in a local factory where he spends most of the day.  There he receives a very good monthly wage which provides him with the financial security he needs to continue with his own businesses.  "Working for a company is not stable" he says "for that reason, I have to make the most of life".

In the afternoons, Jonathan works in his grocery store but the business activity he most enjoys is farming.  Jonathan has been growing peas and potatoes on his parents' land for five years.  The profits he makes in selling his peas allows him to stock his grocery store with more products.  He is currently putting together some capital in order to open a grocery store in the village of Huasahuasi.  He is concentrating all his strength on getting ahead and taking advantage of all the opportunities that life provides him with so that he can help his family enjoy a better quality of life.

Jonathan is a member of the "Los Ángeles de Llanco" (The Angels of Llanco) community bank and this is his fourth loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can realize his goals.  For his part, Jonathan pledges to make his loan repayments on time as he has with his previous loans.

Jonathan enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Jonathan will invest the loan he has requested in buying pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer to spread over his upcoming harvest.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Carlos Sael

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 36 años de edad, el es soltero, cuenta con casa propia la cual está ubicada en el sector llamado ciudad de Dios en el distrito de Pacasmayo, en La Libertad.

Carlos se dedica a brindar servicios de alquiler de sonido para eventos especiales como matrimonios umpleaños bautizos, etc. en la zona en donde vive y en los alrededores, es muy conocido por sus vecinos, ya que para cualquier evento están solicitando sus servicios. Carlos cuenta con mas de 3 años de experiencia en el rubro tiempo que le a permitido conseguir clientes fijos para sus negocio.

Carlos está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 para que pueda dar mantenimiento a la unidad móvil en la que transporta su equipo de sonido, d esta manera su movilizacion sea mucho mas rapida y efectiva poder crecer como empresario en el rubro.

Carlos es una persona muy carismática y de muy buen carácter , que desea crecer como empresario y conseguir una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years of age, single, and has his own home which is located in the region called Ciudad de Dios in the district of Pacasmayo in La Libertad. 

Carlos works in sound equipment rentals for special events such as weddings, birthdays, baptisms etc. in and around the area where he lives. He is very well known by his neighbors, since they are seeking his services for all their events. Carlos has over three years of experience in this line of work during which time he has been able to acquire regular customers for his business. 

Carlos is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 Peruvian soles in order to provide maintenance to the mobile unit in which he transports his sound equipment. Thus he will be able to mobilize much more quickly and effectively, and so grow as a business owner in his line of work. 

Carlos is a very charismatic person and of high character. He wants to grow as a business owner and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain a mobile unit used for transporting his sound equipment.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Florinda is one of the members of her group named Jehova Jireh 1, 2 & 3. It is s a group made by 15 businesswomen dedicated to do different businesses in their houses and by walking. They are located in a rural area outside La Romana, between sugarcane fields. She is a married woman with 5 children, and four of them still live together with her in their simple structure home. 

Florinda has been operating her Comedor (a kind of local restaurant for lunch) around 4 years, where many people from the community attend to have lunch. She started with her savings 5 years ago. She is exciting to receive her second loan with Esperanza, because after she joined the program, she has felt more committed to her business. She plans to use this loan to buy rice, meat, seasoning, canned meals, vegetables, flour, cooking oil, etc.  

She will use her profits to reinvest in her businnes because she wants to have an improved business and to have her dream come true (to have her own house). Her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, meat, cooking oil, canned meals, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 57 años, casada, vive en casa propia que esta ubicada en el Caserío San Eloy del Distrito de Tambogrande, su comunidad es rural y pequeña, con deseos de superase con el tiempo

Justina cuenta con un puesto de venta de ropa, frazadas y variedad de objetos para  obsequios, su negocio lo ha instalado en el lugar donde vive. Justina adquiere sus productos en la ciudad de Lima y los comercializa entre el público que diariamente acude a su negocio. Las prendas que vende son para todo público y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fidelizada. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven cubrir sus gastos en su hogar

Justina está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería y ampliar el rubro del negocio, e ir creciendo poco apoco como empresaria.

Justina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás
texts.en:
Justina is 57 years old and married. She lives in her own home, which is located in the neighborhood of San Eloy in the district of Tambogrande. Her community is small and rural, and its people have the desire to get ahead in the future. 

Justina has a sales stand where she offers clothing, blankets and a variety of gift items. She has set up her business in the place where she lives. Justina buys her products in the city of Lima, and she sells them to the customers who come to her business each day. The garments she sells are for all types of people, and she has a steady customer base. The income provided to her from this work allows her to cover her household expenses. 

Justina is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 Peruvian new soles to buy merchandise and expand the scope of her business. This will allow her to grow little by little as an entrepreneur. 

Justina is a very hard-working woman who puts forth effort every day to get ahead and achieve a better quality of life. The people who know her consider her a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and expand her business.

loans.name: Rosa Benilda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Quiroga se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa. Tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y a pesar de que lleva varios años comprometida no ha podido tener hijos, con ella vive un sobrino que lo crio desde pequeño y es como si fuera su hijo el ya es mayor de edad. Su marido es albañil.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a dos actividades, una a la compra y venta de maní, ella compra el producto en grano a los comerciantes en Calceta el mismo que traslada a su casa donde lo cocina y muele para después entregarlo  a su hermana que lo lleva a Santo Domingo, su hermana entrega a clientes o tiendas del lugar, dice que allá su producto se vende a muy buen precio. Su otra actividad es la cría de animales de corral ya que esto también le deja algo de ganancia. Trabaja sola todos los días siete horas al día.

Este crédito es para comprar maní, pollos y comida para estos para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Este es su sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro y gozar de buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Quiroga meets every two weeks in Quiroga parish in the city Calceta.  The people of this area, by and large, farm, raise animals, and sell their products.  This is where we met Sra. Rosa.  Rosa, 47, lives with her partner, but even after living together for years she has not been able to have children.  Her nephew, that she has raised since he was little, lives with her and is like a son.  He now an adult. Her husband works in construction.  

Sra. Rosa is good housewife who helps her husband with the household expenses by working two jobs.  She buys and sells peanuts.  She buys the product as a grain from merchants in Calceta, brings them home, cooks and grinds them and then gives them to her sister who takes them to Santo Domingo.  Her sister delivers them to customers or stores in the area.  It's said that she sells her product at a good price.  Her other job is raising animals in a pen.  This is another way she makes some money.  She works alone for 7 hours a day.  

This loan is to purchase peanuts, chickens, and feed that will help them grow.  This is her sixth period with the Communal Bank and she likes it because her companions do what they say they are going to do.  She dreams of having her own car and for her and her family to be in good health.

loans.use: Purchase peanuts, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Guadalupe,  tiene 45 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre fruto de la misma han tenido 5 hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores  de edad, uno de ellos estudia en universidad y los  menores en colegio, su marido es radiotécnico.

Tiene una pequeña granja en la casa de sus padres que es donde ella vive junto a su familia, allí ella se dedica a la cría de pollos, nos cuenta que compra de 100 a 200 pollos por temporada, los mismos que los compra cuando  están pequeños en una incubadora en Calceta, los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses y luego cuando están listos los entrega en tiendas o los vende por libras cerca de su casa a los vecinos y allegados. Trabaja todos los días  unas dos  horas al día en todas sus actividades.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un gran desarrollo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace siete años y le gustan los créditos porque con ellos puede financiar su negocio cuando no tiene dinero.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Quiroga” communal bank meets every two weeks in Quiroga Parish in the city of Calceta, a place where its residents are for the most part farmers and raise livestock and sell their production.

We met Guadalupe, 45, here.  She has   spouse and five children, two of them already adults.  One of them is going to university and the younger ones are in high school.  Her husband is a radio technician.

She has a small farm at her parents’ house which is where she and her family live.  She raises chickens there.  She tells us that she buys 100 to 200 chicks per season.  She buys them when they are small from an incubator in Calceta and keeps them for a period of time of two to three months and then when they are ready she delivers them to stores or sells them by the pound near her house to neighbors and close friends.  She works every day about two hours daily on her various chores.

She will use this loan to buy chicks, feed and medicine for them so that they will develop well.  She’s been in the communal bank for seven years and she likes the loans because she can finance her business with them when she doesn’t have any money.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken feed and chicken medicines.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Las Fresitas del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de remedios vegetales, cortezas medicinales y macerados, que los vende en la ciudad de Lima, generalmente lleva pedidos, por ahora. Los envases son botellas de gaseosas, mas adelante comprará sus francos para envasarlo adecuadamente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 25 litros de aguardiente, 3 kilos de corteza de chuchuazi, 1 kilo de kion, 5 kilos de uña de gato, 1 kilo de jergón sacha, 2 kilos de huito, 3 Litros de miel.
Este trabajo lo realiza junto a su esposo, ninguno de sus hijos vive con ellos y tienen que trabajar para poder sustentarse sus gastos básicos y alimentación.
"Gracias a Manuela Ramos por brindar esta ayuda a las mujeres que de verdad lo necesitan".
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of “Las Fresitas del Distrito de Yarinacocha” Communal Bank in the department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old, married and has three children.
She sells herbal remedies, medicinal bark, and macerations that she sells in the city of Lima.  She usually takes orders, for now.  She uses soda bottles for the containers. In the future she will buy jars to package it adequately. 
With her new loan of 2,000 new Peruvian soles, she will buy 25 liters of alcohol, 3 kilos of chuchuazi bark, 1 kilo of ginger, 5 kilos of cat’s claw, 1 kilo of Jergon Sacha, 2 kilos of Huito and 3 liters of honey. 
She undertakes this work with her husband. None of their children live with them, and they have to work in order to cover their basic expenses and food. “Thanks to Manuela Ramos for providing help to these women that really need it.”

loans.use: to buy bark and alcohol.

loans.name: Mercedes Concepcion

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Mercedes. Tiene 54  años de edad, está casada y  fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, todos mayores pero una de sus hijas que es madre soltera vive con ella, allí también vive con ellos su pequeña nieta la misma que es la ilusión de nuestra amiga. Su esposo es chofer de taxi.

Ella es un ama de casa que para generar ingresos para el bienestar de su familia  tiene una pequeña granja de pollos y chanchos, ella compra tanto los pollos como los chanchos cuando están pequeños, los cría por tres a cuatro meses y cuando tienen un peso adecuado los ofrece a los comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus productos, trabaja todos los días de tres a cuatro horas diarias en el cuidado y alimentación de sus animales, su hija y su esposo le ayudan de vez en cuando, nos cuenta que lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien siempre.
 
Este crédito para comprar  pollos, cerdos, alimentos y medicinas para sus animales. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace siete años y le gusta  la facilidad que dan para realizar los pagos.
 
Su sueño  tener un local donde vender sus productos directamente al consumidor.
texts.en:
The “Quiroga” communal bank meets every two weeks in Quiroga Parish in the city of Calceta, a place where its residents are for the most part farmers and raise livestock and sell their production.

We met Mercedes, 54, here.  She is married and has four children, all adults.  However, one of her daughters is a single mother and lives with her.  Her little granddaughter, who is our friend’s thrill, also lives with her.  Her husband’s a taxi driver.

She is a housewife who in order to generate income for her family’s wellbeing has a small farm raising chickens and pigs.  She buys both the chickens and the pigs when they are little, raises them for three or four months and when they reach adequate weight she sells them to merchants that come by her house to buy her products.  She works every day from three to four hours daily caring for and feeding her animals.  Her daughter and husband help her occasionally.  She tells us that she’s been in this line of work for over 15 years and has always done very well.

This loan is to buy chicks, piglets, feed and medicine for her animals.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for seven years and she likes the easy payment plans.  Her dream is to have a locale in order to sell her products direct to the consumer.

loans.use: to buy chicks, pigs, feed and medicine for them.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La señora Zonia es socia D. banco comunal Las Fresitas D. Distrito D. Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Ella se dedica a brindar servicio D. alquiler D. motocarro, el pago por alquiler es diario, esto le permite solventar los gastos básicos D. su casa.

Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, pagará al mecánico por el mantenimiento D. su motocarro, comprará 1 sistema D. arrastre, 2 llantas traseras, 2 cámaras, 2 intermitentes, 1 par D. espejos, 6 focos.
El dinero que recibe a diario lo guarda para cualquier emergencia y también le sirve para el pago a Manuela Ramos, solo tiene un hijo a quien paga sus estudios ya que el otro es independiente.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por permitirle tener un negocio con el que pueD. ayudar a su hijo, solo espera que todo le vaya bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zonia is a member of the communal bank Las Fresitas [The Little Strawberries] from the district of Yarinacocha and department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living providing motocar rental services. The rental payments are maD. daily, which allows her to cover basic living expenses in her home. 

With her new loan of S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, she will pay the mechanic for maintenance of her motocar. She will buy one towing system, two rear tires, 2 chambers, 2 signal lights, one pair of mirrors and 6 light bulbs. 

The money she receives each day she keeps for any emergency, and it also is available for making payments to Manuela Ramos. She is only paying for the education of one child since the other is now independent. 

She thanks Manuela Ramos for allowing her to have a business by which she can help her son. She only hopes that everything go well.

loans.use: to purchase a towing system and tires for her motocar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fleece to make sweaters.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 48 años de edad y es madre soltera de 3 hijos.
Es una de las fundadoras de este banco comunal, en este momento tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas en las afueras de un colegio, donde trabaja solo por las mañanas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 bolsas de taps, 2 bolsas de caramelo, 1 bolsa de juguetes con grajeas, 1/2 ciento de calcomanía, 1 bolsa de chicle, 2 cajas de galletas, 3 tiras de chizitos, 2 tiras de maní confitado, 2 paquetes de frugos, 1 paquete de gaseosa, 1 paquete de agua.
Debido a que su principal clientela son niños, debe tener mucha variedad de golosinas.  Este negoico es relativamente nuevo pero le trae buenas ganancias y además es de medio tiempo.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido educar a sus hijos, porque ella sola tiene que criarlos y solventar los gastos del colegio, ahora solo tiene dos de ellos a su cargo.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Mujeres Del 2000” (Women of the Year 2000) communal bank in the district of Yarinacocha, Ucayali department. She is 48 years old and the single mother of 3 children. She is also one of the founders of her communal bank. At present, she has a tiny business selling snacks outside a school, where she works mornings only.

With her new loan of 3,000 new sols, Maria will purchase 2 bags of taps, 2 bags of caramels, 1 bag of toys with small candies, half a hundred of decals, 1 box of chewing gum, 2 boxes of cookies, 3 strips of cheese puffs, 2 strips of crystallized peanuts, 2 packages of fruit drinks, 1 case of soft drinks, and 1 case of bottled water.

Since her principal customers are children, she needs to have a greater variety of snacks. This business is relatively new but it attracts good earnings and it is part time.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Maria has been able to educate her children. She alone has had to raise them and cover school costs. Now, she only has 2 in her charge.

loans.use: buy snacks at wholesale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy tiene su propio negocio, en donde lleva más de veintiún año, laborando como modista, labor que ah realizado en su casa, y en una empresa en medio tiempo. Su esposo es sastre y ambos se ayudan entre sí.
Daisy confecciona vestido, faldas, pantalones, short, sabanas, fundas, el cual atraves de la experiencia ha logrado captar clientela, ella hace los vestidos y los pone a la venta, y otros clientes le llevan la tela y solo cobra la costura.
Para ella ha sido de gran satisfacción su negocio ya que ha ayudado mucho a su familia, con la educación de sus dos hijos, así como Afodenic también ha otorgado financiamiento en donde gracia a esto préstamo ha crecido sus ventas al producir más.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara tela de lino, baby car, sincatex, dacron, para seguir produciendo mas vestido.
texts.en:
Daisy owns her own dressmaking business.  She has owned her business for more than twenty-one years.  She carries out her work at home and also works part time for a company.  Her husband is a tailor and they both help each other.

Daisy makes dresses, skirts, pants, shorts, sheets and covers.  Through her experience, she has managed to gain customers.  She makes her garments and then sells them.  Other customers bring material to her and she only charges for the sewing.

Daisy's business has given her a lot of satisfaction since it has really helped her family and helped toward her two children's education.  Afodenic have provided her with loans which have helped her to increase her sales by enabling her to produce more.

Daisy will use this new loan to buy linen, Sincatex and Dacron so that she can continue producing more clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric with which to produce more clothes so that she can make better profits

loans.name: Leonor Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Leonor es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 67 años, es viuda y tiene tres hijos.
El tiempo que lleva en Manuela Ramos es muy poco, pero quiere surtir mas su negocio porque todavía le faltan algunos productos que le solicitan sus clientes, además que su negocio está ubicado en una avenida muy transitada.  Ella tiene una pequeña bodega.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 bolsa D. pañales descartables, comida para cachorro,1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 caja D. leche, 1 caja D. conservas, 2 tiras D. champú en sachet, y materiales D. limpieza como detergentes.
Su casa la comparte con su nieto, quien es el que le ayuda en su negocio en sus ratos libres, Leonor piensa que él será quien la cuiD. en su vejez.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos pueD. trabajar para ayudar a su nieto y  que no le falte nada para poder terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonor, 67, is a member of the Mujeres Del 2000 community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  She is a widow with three children.
Sra. Leonor owns a small corner shop.  She's new to Manuela Ramos and she wants to stock her business with the kinds of products that her customers are likely to ask for, especially since her business is located on a busy avenue.  
She will use this S/.1,000.00 new soles loan to buy bulk supplies of: disposable diapers; dog food; rice; sugar; milk; canned goods; shampoo; and cleaning products.  
Sra. Leonor shares her house with her grandson who also helps her with the business when he can.  She expects to depend on him when she can no longer care for herself.  
Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she can help her grandson so that he has everything he needs to build a career.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: El Señor Juan Bautista tiene 56 años. Su actividad económica es  brindar el servicio de transporte. Su actividad empieza a las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, el lugar se llama la reynaga, Juan es quien se encarga de transportar a todos sus clientes a las diferentes comarcas. Tiene más de 12 años de tener este negocio, ha sido poco a poco que ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y su familia. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de llantas, mantenimiento de su camión, focos, caja de cambios entre otros. su deseo es expandir su negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en: Sr. Juan Bautista, 56, drives a taxi for a living.  He works from 7 in the morning until 8 at night.  The business is called La Reynaga.  Juan is responsible for ferrying customers around from place to place.  His income from driving a taxi has supported him for more than 12 years now and he's slowly managed to improve his life and the lives of his family.  He will use this loan to buy tires, pay for vehicle maintenance, new headlights and a new gearbox, etc.  He wants to expand his business so that he can get ahead in the world.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance for his taxi business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 29 años reside en el caserío de Antabamba, se caracteriza por ser un padre de familia muy amoroso. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rina de 25 años  y su querida hija Abigail de 3 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad económica de la zona es la agricultura, desde niño aprendió a cuidar la tierra producirla y vivir de la venta de su cosecha. Desde entonces trabajó en el cultivo de papa, maíz, arvejas y habas. Es así que cada mañana se dedica a sembrar y cuidar de sus plantas, pues de ello depende para obtener productos de calidad y lograr venderlos en el mercado central de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fertilizar sus tierras, ya que demora días y hasta semanas en terminar de esparcirlos. Por otro lado, en ocasiones su esposa la apoya, ya que la mayor parte de su tiempo se dedica de cuidar de sus vacas para extraer leche y elaborar queso, que son productos que también vende en la ciudad de Palca y Tarma, pues hay bastante demanda de estos alimentos.  Por eso más adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos, para tener mejores ingresos, asimismo de invertir en la compra de vacas de calidad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Rolando de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca lechera de la raza “Holstein”, que cuesta un promedio de dos mil nuevos soles. Asimismo comprará sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de papa de la variedad “mamalucha”.
texts.en: Roland, 29, lives in Antabamba.  You might best characterize him as a loving father.  He lives in a house that he owns with his wife, Rina, 25, and their much-loved daughter, Abigail, 3.  Roland works hard for Abigail.  He's been a farmer all his life, learning to care for the land and living on what he grows from an early age.  He grows potatoes, maize, beans and peas.  He gets up every morning to take care of his crop because he depends on good harvests to support his family.  He sells what he grows at the central market at Tarma because that's where he can get the best price for his crop.  The thing that Roland likes best about farming is harvesting the land because that's when the months of hard work pay off.  He's worked the farm for 15 years and his biggest challenge is fertilizing his land because the job takes days and even weeks to finish.  His wife sometimes helps him, but she spends most of her day caring for their cows, milking them and making cheese from the milk.  Roland sells the milk and cheese products in the cities of Palca and Tarma because there's a big demand for them in those places.  For the future, he wants to increase his income by improving his harvests and investing in better cows for his milk and cheese business.  Roland belongs to the Los Pinos de Antabamba community bank and this is his sixth MFP loan.  He's grateful for the loans because they help him advance his business.  He is committed to repaying this loan in the agreed-upon time, just as he's repaid past loans.  He also wants to thank the members of his community bank for being responsible and supportive of one another.  Roland will use this loan to buy a Holstein cow which, on average, cost two thousand new soles.  He will also buy sacks of an organic manure, called Mamalucha, to fertilize his potato crop

loans.use: to buy a cow and supplies for his farming and livestock business.

loans.name: Yadira Agustina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente dedicada  en gran parte a la agricultura y cría de  animales, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yadira, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha  procreado dos hijos de 12 y 3  años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos estudia en colegio. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Es una muy buena esposa y madre de familia que para  ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar hace varios años empezó un negocio  de venta de ropa por catálogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido ya que ella enseña las revistas para que los clientes elijan que es lo que desean, ella realiza los pedidos y los recibe en una distribuidora en la ciudad de Calceta, luego entrega la mercadería a sus clientes y les da facilidades de pago. 
Trabaja todos los días de tres a cuatro horas diarias. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace seis ciclos y le gusta porque les da facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los padres.
texts.en:
In Quiroga parish in the city of Calceta, a place where people work mainly in agriculture and livestock production, the communal bank "Quiroga" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Yadira, aged 32, who is in a common-law marriage that has produced 2 children aged 12 and 3.  Her oldest is in middle school and her husband works as a farmer.

Yadira is a very good wife and mother who started a business selling clothing through a catalog to help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells door-to-door taking orders, and she receives her products from a distributor in the city of Calceta.  Later she delivers the merchandise to her customers and allows them to pay for the goods on credit.

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing and other garments.  She has been with her communal bank for 6 loan cycles, and she likes it because of the easy payment terms of the loans.

Her dream is to have her own house, since she lives in her parent's house.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando vive en el departamento de Cochabamba en la provincia de Cercado, el lleva ya tres años separado de su esposa, tuvieron problemas y se separaron y al separarse el decidio dejarle todo a su esposa y no pedirle nada porque ella se quedo con uno de sus hijos , el regreso a vivir con su mamá que tiene 89 años, ahora el quiere empezar de nuevo.
El solicita un crédito para poder comprar computadoras y asi activar un negocio nuevo con la cual pueda mantener a su mamá y demostrar que puede volver a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rolando lives in the department of Cochabamba in Cercado province.  He has been separated from his wife for 3 years.  They had problems and so separated.  Upon their separation he decided to leave everything to his wife and not ask for anything for himself because she was left with one of their children.  He went back to live with his mother, who is 89 years old, and now he is starting all over again.

He requests a loan so that he can buy computers and in this way start up a new business.  With this business he will be able to support his mother and show that he can once again move forward with his life.

loans.use: to buy computers to start up a business

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Hipólito tiene 36 años de edad,  el es casado, vive en casa de la madre con una hija que ya es dependiente. Hipólito vive en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Mórrope,  cuenta con servicios de agua, el lugar donde vive  es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

Hipólito se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales,  dicha labor la realiza desde hace 12 años, el cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando su ganado se encuentra con el tamaño y peso ideal lo comercializa en el mercado local, teniendo experiencia otorgada por la madre con la cual inicio este negocio.

Hipólito está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para poder pagar la mano de obra para la construcción de su domicilio. 

Hipólito tiene la seguridad de que su negocio cuenta con un mercado amplio de comercialización, lo que garantiza el éxito, el es una persona perseverante y responsable, las personas que lo conocen lo describen como alguien amable y generoso.
texts.en:
Hipólito is 36 years old, married, and lives in his mother's house with a dependent daughter.  Hipólito lives in a marginal urban area in the Mórrope district that has running water.  The place that he lives is a small community of about 100 families.

Hipólito works raising and selling animals.  He has done this work for 12 years.  He has appropriate and spacious animal pens that are located in the back part of his house.  When his livestock reaches the idea size and weight, he sells it at the local market.  His mother started the business and taught him about it.

Hipólito is asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to pay for labor for the construction of his home.

Hipólito is confident that his business has a large market for sales, which guarantees success.  He is a responsible and persevering person.  The people who know him describe him as kind and generous.

loans.use: to pay for labor to construct his home.

loans.name: Nieve Margarita

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente dedicada  en gran parte a la agricultura y cría de  animales, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

Aquí conocimos a la señora  Nieves, tiene 64 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene  6 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus propias familias, su hija menor es quien aun vive con ella. Su marido es agricultor.

Para ganarse la vida y así poder colaborar con su esposo en los gastos del hogar ella instaló un pequeño puesto de comida en el sector por donde ella vive, allí trabaja todas las tardes en la venta de sus deliciosos platos y en las mañanas se dedica a preparar todo lo que va a vender. Además de comida prepara y vende ricos corviches y empanadas que a sus clientes les encantan, nos cuenta que su especialidad es el arroz con menestra y carne asada. Lleva en su negocio por más de 10 años ya que a la gente le encanta sus platos.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, carne, maní, plátano, pescado entre otros ingredientes necesarios para los deliciosos platos. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y le gustan los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y gozar de mucha salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
In Quiroga parish in the city of Calceta, a place where many of the people work in agriculture and livestock production, the communal bank "Quiroga" meets every 15 days. 

Here we meet Nieves, 64, who is married and has 6 children who are now grown and have their own families.  Her youngest daughter still lives with her and her husband is a farmer.

In order to make a living and help her husband with the household expenses, she set up a small food stand in the neighborhood where she lives.  There she works every afternoon selling her delicious dishes.  In the mornings she makes everything that she is going to sell.  In addition to prepared meals, she sells corviche (an Ecuadorian dish made of fried banana dough and seafood) and empanadas that her customers love.  She tells us that her specialty is rice and beans and carne asada.  She has been running her business for 10 years, since the people love her cooking.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, peanuts, bananas, fish and other ingredients that she needs to make her delicious dishes.  She has been with her communal bank almost from the start, and she enjoys the benefits she receives from the institution.

Her dreams are to have a big restaurant and to see herself and her loved ones enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, peanuts, bananas, fish and other ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, de 56 años reside en el caserío de Antabamba, se caracteriza por ser un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Julia de 57 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes cuida con mucha dedicación. Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Ignacio en su chacra, le han ayudado a mejorar la economía de su familia, ya que junto a su esposa son los encargados de velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, es por eso que trabaja todo lo que puede, sembrando papa, arvejas, habas, maíz y hortalizas, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos, ya que sabe que unos productos sanos se venden a mejor precio. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros del poblado de Antabamba, que es donde tiene sus terrenos agrícolas. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a la compra y venta de reses, donde los enseba para luego venderlos a un mayor precio. Es por ello que para el futuro espera mejorar sus chacras y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Ignacio de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, 20 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “yungay”, abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales.
texts.en:
Ignacio is 56 years old and lives in the small village of Antabamba.  He is noted for being a very simple and hard-working father.  He lives in his own home together with his wife, 57 year-old Julia, and his three dependent children who he looks after with a lot of dedication.

Ignacio's arduous workdays on his farm have helped him to improve his family's economic situation.  He and his wife are responsible for looking after their children's well-being and so they work as hard as they can, growing potatoes, peas, beans, corn and other vegetables.  They then take their produce to sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

What Ignacio most enjoys about his work is caring for his crops since he knows that healthy produce fetches a better price.  He has been in this business for 12 years and he considers the hardest part of his work to be having to climb the steep hills of Antabamba which is where he has his farmland.

Ignacio has support from his wife who buys and sells cattle.  She fattens them up and then sells them on for a higher price.  In the future, Ignacio hopes to improve his farm and sow all of his land.

Ignacio is a member of the "Los Pinos de Antabamba" (The Pine Trees of Antabamba) community bank and this is his sixth loan from MFP.  He hopes for a small loan which will enable him to reach his goals.  For his part, he pledges once more to make his repayments on time, as he has done with his previous loans.  Ignacio enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Ignacio will invest the money he has requested in buying a bag of pea seeds, 20 sacks of Yungay potatoes, organic manure and natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds, 20 sacks of potato seeds, organic manure and natural fertilizers

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia tiene 48 años está casada con el señor Ricardo , juntos tienen 3 hijos los cuales dependen D. los clientes , son muy trabajadores y unidos , pero doña Eusebia está muy preocupada ya que su marido se encuentra enfermo , está mal del corazón y usa Marcapaso. Doña Eusebia y su familia viven en la comunidad D. Itocta , tienen una pequeña casa donD. todos viven, su principal actividad económica es la producción D. la leche cruda , cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración D. productos lácteos. 
El préstamo será destinado para compra D. una cabeza D. ganado lechero , con lo cual aumentara sus producción , y D. esa manera incrementara sus ingresos.
Entre sus sueños y metas es crecer más en la actividad, hasta tener una pequeña granja D. por lo menos 20 cabezas D. ganado lechero y lo más importante que su marido pueda mejorar D. su enfermedad o por lo menos contralar y que viva tranquilo para ello el esposo no trabaja solo le ayuda con el cuidado del ganado a su esposa
texts.en:
Eusebia is 48 years old and married to Ricardo.  They have three dependent children.  Eusebia's is a very hard-working and close family.  However, Eusebia is very worried because her husband is sick.  He has heart problems and uses a pacemaker.  Eusebia and her family all live in a small house in the community of Itocta.  Their business activity is producing raw milk which they deliver to a company that makes dairy products.
