Eusebia will use her loan to buy one head of dairy cattle which will increase her production and, in this way, increase her income.

Eusebia's dreams and goals incluD. growing further in her business until she owns a small farm with at least 20 head of dairy cattle.  The most important thing, however, is for her husband to get over his illness or at least manage to control it so that he can live peacefully.  Eusebia's husband is not working but helps her to take care of her cattle.

loans.use: to buy one head of dairy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora Nancy es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución ya que tanto ella como sus amigas han podido a través de los créditos sacar sus negocios adelante. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad, pero dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, en la cual además de productos de primera necesidad también vende algunas medicinas, artículos de bazar, papelería,  tarjetas telefónicas, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, compra sus productos en Calceta y otros los recibe en su local. También prepara y vende bolos de frutas (helados) que son muy apetecido por sus clientes, nos cuenta que tiene su negocio por más de 15 años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que ofrece gran variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Este crédito es para surtir aun mas su tienda va a comprar arroz, azúcar, embutidos, aceites, frutas, enlatados y otros productos de primera necesidad.

Su sueño es tener una gran tienda en el centro de Calceta.
texts.en:
In Quiroga parish in the city of Calceta, a place where people work mainly in agriculture and livestock production, the communal bank "Quiroga" meets every 15 days.

Nancy is the founding member of the bank, and she likes it because of the benefits provided by the institution, since she and her friends have been able to make progress with their businesses with the loans that they have been able to take.  Nancy is 45 years old, married and has 3 grown children, but two of them still live in her house.  Her husband is a farmer.

She has a small grocery store in her house, where she sells consumer staples as well as some medicines, general merchandise, stationery, telephone cards and other items.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm, and at times until even later.  She buys her products in Calceta and has others shipped to her store.  She also prepares and sells bags of frozen fruit juice that her customers have a taste for.  She tells us that she has had her business for more than 15 years, and that it has always done very well, since she offers a great variety of products to her customers.

This loan will be used to increase the supply of merchandise in her store. She will buy: rice, sugar, sausages, cooking oil, fruit, canned goods and other consumer staples.  Her dream is to have a big store in the center of Calceta.

loans.use: to buy  rice, sugar, sausages, canned goods and other consumer staples

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables and milk

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 60 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 02 hijos a su cargo Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, dicha casa está ubicada en el caserío La Salina en el distrito de Tambogrande  en  Piura. Esperanza  vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Esperanzase dedica a la cría y comercialización de ganado ovino, caprino y pavos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años y cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos. Los animales cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.
Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia de 2 hectáreas de terreno agrícola en la cual tiene mango y cacao en producción. También se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno (vacas lecheras).

Por lo mismo Esperanza ha solicitado un préstamo  de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de animales y su respectiva comida. Ella desea incrementar sus ventas podrá solventar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  

Esperanza es conocida por ser una persona honesta, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de  mejorar su estilo de vida en la vida.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 60 years old, married, and has two children in her care.  She lives in her own home with her husband and her children.  It is located in the village of La Salina in the Tambogrande district in Piura.  She lives in the rural part of the district and does not have access to utilities.

Esperanza works raising and selling livestock like sheep, goats, and turkeys.  She has done this work for six years and she has appropriate and spacious pens.  When the animals reach their ideal size and weight, she sells them at the local market.  Her husband is a farmer who has his own two hectare parcel of farm land where he grows mango and cacao.  He also works raising dairy cows.

Esperanza has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase animals and feed for them.  She wants to increase her sales to settle her loan and improve her quality of life.

Esperanza is known for being an honest and hardworking person with the desire to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Hermano Miguel (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Hermano Miguel está formado por 9 socias quienes en su mayoría son familia, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ayudar económicamente en sus hogares y salir adelante junto a sus familias. Viven  por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad más importante  del País. Su gente, su cultura, sus tradiciones, la variedad de su gastronomía y la belleza de sus paisajes hacen de esta ciudad encantadora y de ensueños. 

La Señora. Gladys vive por el sector de la Orquídeas, se encuentra en el banco comunal  7 años, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 8 y 1 año y medio de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Gladys es profesora y hace dos años se encuentra ejerciendo su profesión en la escuelita de la ciudad, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Esika, esta labor la realiza hace 3 años.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es  obtener su licenciatura ya que solo le falta un año más de estudios.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo. Por esta ocasión nos acompaña en la foto el Señor Danny que es el promotor.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Hermano Miguel" is comprised of 9 members, most of whom are related.  They work in different activities that help them to support their households and get ahead with their families.  They live in the Las Orquideas neighborhood in the city of Cuenca, which is the third largest city in the country.  Its people, its culture, its traditions, the variety of its cuisine and the beauty of the surrounding countryside make this city enchanting and dreamlike.

Gladys lives in the Las Orquideas neighborhood.  She has been in this communal bank for 7 years.  She is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children aged eight and one and a half.  Her oldest daughter studies in a school in the city.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic.  They do not own a home, and so live in a rented dwelling.

Gladys is a teacher.  She has been teaching in a small school in her city for two years.  In her free time she sells Esika brand cosmetics.  She has been selling cosmetics for three years.

She will invest the proceeds of this loan in perfumes, creams and cosmetics to expand her business.

Her goal is to get her degree, since she lacks only one more year of studies.

The small insert photo is of one of the members who could not be present when they took the group photograph.  On this occasion the group photo also includes Danny, who is a loan officer.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Bazarragchaa

texts.en:
Bazarragchaa is 28 years old and lives with her husband in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is an unemployed man who stays home all day. She manages a general goods trading business at her store. She started her business in March, 2010. Since then her business has been quite successful, which allowed her to increase her working capital to 500,000-600,000 MNT. Now her business earnings are the only source of income for her family. Therefore she works hard in order to continue her business. 

She is a diligent woman who is planning to expand her business and to have a PC service center in near future. She says, "I am planning to open a PC service center that will be managed by my husband." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory such is a socks, hairpins, picture-frames, etc., for her business.

loans.use: purchase more inventory of general goods to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, and cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida has a common-law husband with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Loida is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Loida has a "carinderia" (local eatery) business in the Philippines. Loida requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Loida has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Loida would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a decorations business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her decorations to sell for her arts business.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for three years. Ma. Elena earns more income from trisikad (three-wheeled) transport.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her decorations.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Et

texts.en:
Mrs. Et resides in Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. She owns a kiosk, a wooden store at Baray market. She sells goods in the store, for example cooking ingredients, soft drinks, cakes and sweets and other necessary items. She is able to make around US$ 2 in revenue each day for the family’s needs. 

To generate extra income, her husband works in fishing activity, earning about US$ 2 each day also. In order to make her sales business more successful and increase her profit, Mrs. Et has asked for some funds from Kiva to buy additional items for resale. In the future, she thinks she can enlarge her selling size, building a new and bigger house to live in and supporting her two children till they graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to buy additional items for resale.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Mrs. Tuya is 60 years old, widowed, and lives with her mother in her mother’s one-room apartment. She speaks Mongolian, Russian and English. Her husband was getting a PhD in the USA but passed away suddenly while he was visiting in Mongolia. After he died, everything she was planning in her life was torn apart. Then she had to move to Mongolia to look after her mom because of the health problems she was having. Her daughter is studying in the USA. Since she came back to Mongolia and she rented a small shop space in one of the shopping centers in town and started to resell clothes from China.

loans.use: buy more clothes to resell in order to make more profits to support her mother.

loans.name: Filchester

texts.en:
Filchester is a-26 year-old farmer in Mocag Baggao, Cagayan, where he has lived for two years. He is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 to buy rice and corn varieties. Every harvest, Filchester is able to generate the average net income of PHP50,000 in corn. This income is used to expand his farm land area. 

He is married and soon will have his first child. He is so excited and hoping for a healthy baby. Filchester says he will work harder for his family's future.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn varieties to plant.

loans.name: Ernesta

texts.en:
Ernesta is a farmer working in the Philippines in the far place of Mocag Baggao, Cagayan. She is asking for a loan amount of PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers and a seed variety of corn. She has been doing the business for 7 years with her husband Jaime.

She is now 39 years old, a mother to four school-aged children. Through their average net profit from farming of around PHP30,000, Ernesta is able to send her children in school continuously. In the future, she hopes for her children's success for she knows their success someday is also hers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a seed variety of corn.

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Javzandulam is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two daughters, age 11 and 15, go to a local secondary school. She manages a mobile meat-trading business with the help of her husband in her town. She started her business in 2007 and has been able to stabilize her business. They collect meat and livestock from herders and sell them to city residents or to workers at the mining industry. 

With years of business operation she gained much experience and is planning to expand her business in the future. In addition, she manages a grocery trading business in order to supplement to her earnings. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says, "I want to have a car with my earnings." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and livestock for her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat and livestock.

loans.name: Serchmaa

texts.en: Serchmaa is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son, age 22, and daughter, age 15, are students. She manages an used clothing trading business with the help of her husband in her town. She started her business in 2003 and gained much experience and knowledge. They collect orders from their customers and bring the products to their homes. Besides their trading business they conduct a transportation business in their town. Now they have many regular customers whom are happy with the services they provide. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I want my children to be educated and have a better life. Also I would like to have my own apartment or house someday." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods in order to increase her business sales.

loans.use: purchase more goods for resale in her used clothing business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is 38 years old and is married. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 30 years. Roberto is asking for a loan amount of PHP30,000 to purchase fertilizers as manure and seed for rice to be planted in their farm. Roberto hopes this loan will grow his operations. Currently, he earns PHP 100,000 each crop in this field of work. Roberto desires to maintain his earnings in his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Jade

texts.en:
Jade is 52 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquita city, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with 2 children.

Jade works as a fisherman, he and his wife helping each other. Jade catches fish and his wife delivers fish to the market. Jade has been doing this kind of work for 20 years. He earns PHP 3,500.00 per month. Jade wanted to buy an additional fishing net to double his catch every day. Jade requested a loan at GDMPC PHP 5,000.00 to buy fishing materials.

Jade has been a member of GDMPC for  one year. In the future, Jade hopes that he will be a member in good standing in GDMPC and that he can buy additional fishing boat.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorng is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for a long time. She also relies on her husband’s income; he works in a rubber plantation, in Baray district. Mrs. Thorng is 50 and the mother of three kids, two of whom are employed in different jobs so they are also the core people for generating financial resources in the family. 

Recently, Mrs. Thorng has needed more money to start growing her crops, but her savings are not enough to plant yet, so Mrs. Thorng has requested a loan to plant a potato crop.

loans.use: to plant a potato crop.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 33 years old and has four children. Alma is married and three of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming fish in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and pay for the expansion of her fishpond.

Alma has been operating the fishpond for five years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and pay  for the expansion of her fishpond.

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en:
Urtnasan is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a salesperson and his younger two sons go to a secondary school. His older daughter, age 22, gave birth and stays home. He manages a transportation service business in Ulaanbaatar city. He started his business in 2005 with his truck. In addition he works as a welder in order to supplement to his earnings. He makes doors, windows, and window protectors for his customers. Now his business has been stabilized which allowed him to fix his truck. 

He is a hardworking man who attributes his business success to his good managerial skills. He says, "While working as a welder I have gained much profit. Therefore I am planning to build a workshop in order to expand my business." He is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials to build his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a workshop.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 37 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Jocelyn works as a fishe woman and she catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years with the monthly income of 2,800.00. Jocelyn wanted to have additional income to support her family needs and her children's education. But her wooden fishing boat is very old and it's been damaged. She needs to replace it with another brand new fishing boat. So Jocelyn requested a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to purchase a brand new fishing boat.

Jocelyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In  the future, Jocelyn prays that someday she will have 5 to 10 fishing boats to continue and improve their living and for the education of her children.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase a brand new fishing boat.

loans.name: Gandolgor

texts.en: Gandolgor is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Zuun Ail of Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a plumber and her younger son is a pupil. She manages a construction material trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 1997 and gained much experience. She is a polite woman who is planning to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more construction materials to resell.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
The woman person shown in the picture is Mrs. Ung, 35 years old, who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She owns a small store in front of a local busy [market] which is full of villagers and passengers going to buy something. She uses her store to sell breakfast and dinner foods. She generates a profit of approximately $5 US a day to help meet her family’s daily expenses with more stability. 

Mrs. Ung's husband is a rice cultivator as well as a fisherman. This couple has only one child who works in the construction field. Mrs. Ung will be using part of this requested money to purchase pig feed and piglets. The rest of the loan will be used for the crop planting business.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and piglets; the rest of the loan will be used for planting crops.

loans.name: Javkhlan

texts.en:
Mr.Javkhlan is 24 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old daughter in his father’s apartment. His wife recently graduated from the university. He used to run an internet cafe in his own groundfloor apartment till May 2011. But he rented it to someone, and now he is planning to start another business. The new business he is planning to start is a food supply to a mining company in Dundgobi province. 

He already arranged the transportation. and now he is asking for a loan to buy more food products to deliver to the campsite. The loan he is taking will be used to buy food and groceries and to supply catering companies at the mining campsite in the countryside in order to improve his family's living conditions. In the future he dreams of opening his own construction panel factory.

loans.use: buy food and groceries and to supply catering companies at a mining campsite in the countryside.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
This humble woman who is sitting under a wooden roof, is Mrs. Keo, a domestic farmer in Baray district. She has owned and operated a farming business since she was single. She learned this skill from her parents. She can use her fertile land to plant rice crop annually. With this work, she can earn a profit of an average of $1.75 per day. She is a single woman and now lives with her sister, her niece and nephew, and she also depends on their incomes. 

Mrs. Keo will be using her loan to buy a used motorbike for her nephew to ride to his work place so he can get to work on time and save the motor taxi costs.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike for her nephew to ride to his work place.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan, 22 years old, is a primary teacher in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap Province. She typically makes around $62.50  in income each month to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. She has been married for several years to Mr. San, 23, a local farmer, and they are blessed with a child who is still very young. Beside her work, she always assists her husband to grow various crops on her own land. 

Due to lacking funds, Mrs. Kan decided to seek a loan to hire a plowing machine to plow her land so she can begin to plant her crop this rainy season.

loans.use: to hire a plowing machine to plow her land.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 34 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. She is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice to sell. Cristy also raises pigs and runs a sari-sari store. She works hard to support her family.

Cristy has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase fertilizers, piglets, feeds and more items to sell in her sari-sari, like canned goods. Cristy hopes to earn better and be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets, feeds and more items to sell.

loans.name: Gelderia

texts.en:
Gelderia is 42 years old and lives in Upper Disakan, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with six children. Gelderia works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to buy fish to sell.

Gelderia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Gelderia hopes to make her business grow to help her family.

loans.use: to buy different kind of fish for her fish-selling business.

location.town: Upper Disakan, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Vich

texts.en:
Mrs. Vich has a small kiosk where she sells cakes, sweets, and cooking ingredients, and she also provides telephone service to her neighbors for a fee. She has been running this sales business for over two years, earning a profit of an average of US$8 to cover the daily expenses in her family. She doesn’t have a life partner as she divorced her husband several years ago. She always tries to earn money to feed her two children who are students. 

Mrs. Vich would like to request a Kiva loan to buy pig-feed, piglets and to accumulate a larger quantity of inventory items for her kiosk. Mrs. Vich hopes she will be able to make more income for her family to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy pig-feed, piglets and to accumulate a larger quantity of inventory items.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
61-year-old Erlinda is a farmer who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She primarily grows rice to sell. She also has coconut trees planted on part of her land. Erlinda also owns and manages a small sari-sari store. She sells various items like noodles, vinegar and other food products and personal care items.

Erlinda's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is in the business of raising hogs. She has a piggery in her backyard. Geneva sells her pigs at her town's market. She also tills a small parcel of land where she grows rice.

Geneva plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. She hopes to have a stable income so she could continue supporting her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mr. Lang, 23, is a fisherman in the province of Siem Reap. He started this job in 2000 and is getting a daily income of approximately $4. Lang’s wife’s name is Khem; she is 21 and also helps him in the same business. They are good parents who try their utmost to earn money to feed their child and use for the other expense of the family. 

Mr. Lang will use his loan to repair his house which is broken because of heavy rain. For the future, they wish to have a suitable house for their family to live in and sustain their fishing business and support their child in higher education.

loans.use: to repair his house which is broken because of heavy rain.

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
From the province of Siem Reap, Mrs. Loem is a 21-year-old married woman who lives in a small wooden house which is located along the river. Mrs. Loem and her husband sell various kinds of items to all travelers and villagers who come to buy something in the busy market. They have over two years' experience in this business, and their sales business is running smoothly because of their good communication skills. 

In order to make the business do even better, Mrs. Loem will use the loan she has asked for to buy more essential goods for resale.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods for resale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married with two children. Alicia is 56 years old and lives in Upper Disakan, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Alicia sells bananas for a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 2,000 PHP to purchase more bananas to retail.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Alicia hope to have a better living and make her children finish in school and have a good work to help the family.

loans.use: To purchased  bananas for her banana retail business

location.town: Upper Disakan, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She owns and manages a sari-sari store. Virgie sells items like toothpaste, shampoo and biscuits to the people in her community. She earns about 3000 PHP per month from the store.

Virgie plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, detergent soap and canned goods. Virgie hopes  this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, detergent soap and canned goods

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moun is a fish-seller in the local market, in Siem Reap Province. Most people live next to or along the Tunle Sap River which is the best place for fishing. Mrs. Moun is one of those people, and she presently relies on selling fish at the busy local market. She sells fish that she either gets from her son or buys from a wholesale supplier. 

Mrs. Moun’s husband works as a soldier. Mrs. Moun is blessed with six children; one is married and the other five are single. Mrs. Moun has applied for a loan to purchase fishing implements for her to use in a fishing activity. With the remainder of the funds, she plans to dig a pond for raising fish.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and to dig a pond to raise fish in.

loans.name: Babet

texts.en:
Babet is 41 years old.  She is married and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Babet requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Babet has been with the organization for three years now and has had two loans in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Babet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ma. Brimlee

texts.en:
Ma. Brimlee is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working 32-year-old entrepreneur.

Ma. Brimlee has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Brimlee requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish nets and other fishing gear.

Ma. Brimlee has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Ma. Brimlee would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy additional fish nets and other fishing gear.

loans.name: Otgonmend

texts.en: Otgonmend is 30 years old and lives with his wife and 3 year old daughter in Darkhan, the -second largest city in Mongolia . His wife stays home and looks after their child. He has been running a small shop which sells mobile phones, chargers and phone accessories from China since 2008.  Recently Otgonmend started a cell phone repair service based on the experience he gained in the  last 3 years.  He thinks that he can increase his shop income by offering his customers more varieties of cell phones to choose from. Therefore he needs to buy more cell phones for his shop..

loans.use: To buy more cell phones to resell in his mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Genly

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Genly works hard to support her family.

She has a barbecue vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Genly is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her barbecue stand and buy ingredients for her barbecue vending business.

Genly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her barbecue stand and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 36 years old and married with two children. Evaline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like toothpaste, grocery items, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Evaline has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from her business buying and selling coconuts.

Evaline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Kristyl

texts.en:
Kristyl is 20 years old and single.  She works very hard to help her parents. Kristyl runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, grocery items, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Kristyl has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, bread, bottled products and other basic commodities. 

In the future, Kristyl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a "carinderia" (small eatery) business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy kitchen utensils for her "carinderia".

Mary Grace has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for her "carinderia" (eatery).

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is 56 years old. She has three children and lives with her family in H. Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been making a living by farming and raising pigs for 11 years. They have requested a loan to invest in their business and buy additional pigs. She hopes that their business will run smoothly and help her to improve her income and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and raise pigs.

loans.name: Firdous' Group

texts.en:
Firdous is married. Her husband has a business selling clothes. He has recently started this business and is working very hard to establish it. He purchases clothes from different cities and sells to his customers locally to earn profits.
Firdous is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients in order to share the financial burden with her husband. She is also a very good housewife and does her household tasks very well. She is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Her sons work in a clothes shop while her daughters are getting a religious education.
Firdous has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, because her husband wants to buy clothes in bulk to expand his business. This will help him offer more variety to his customers and earn better profits. Firdous is hopeful that an investment will help her husband to make more profit and improve his business.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Firdous.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 33 years old and has given birth to a daughter who is 3 years old. She is a housewife and carries out her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is very active and performs her work very well. Her husband has a dairy business. For that purpose, he has two buffalos and also three cows. Najma’s husband is a very hardworking person. He gets up early in the morning and  milks the buffalos and cows to sell to his community clients. Najma provides full support to him in operating his business. She takes care of his cattle and also assists him in getting the milk. 

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, because her husband wants to buy another dairy cow. This will help him get larger quantities of milk to meet the needs of his customers. He has been operating his business for the past 20 years and Najma is confident that an investment will help him improve it further.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 45 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, grocery items, etc. 

Merlyn has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Merlyn aspires to save money to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Matea  works hard to support her family. She has a fruit & vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Matea  is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fruit to sell in her stall.

Matea  has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the production volume of heating equipment

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is divorced. She has a grown son, Alexander. Yelena is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she sells women’s outer clothing in the central city market. She launched this small business 16 years ago.  Presently, Yelena has about 35,000 grivnyas worth of clothes in inventory. Her monthly profit amounts to 6,000 grivnyas a month.
 
Yelena is seeking a 15,000 grivnya loan to restock her merchandise and generate additional income. She believes a good array of clothing items will help her better serve the needs of her clients and increase her sales. Additional income will allow Yelena to invest more in her family’s well-being. She hopes to do some remodeling at home to provide a better living environment for her son and herself.

loans.use: to restock her merchandise

loans.name: Girlita

texts.en:
Girlita, is married with three children. Girlita is 60 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Girlita has a mini-grocery store at home, that sells all kind of food (sugar, noodles, can goods and other items),home (laundry soap, bath soap, floor wax) and school supplies (notebooks, ball pen and pencil) that earn PHP 3,800 per month. She has had this business for five years. Girlita contributes her income to her husband to sustain their monthly consumption. Girlita wanted to have additional stocks like feeds for sale because most of her neighbors are asking for feeds everyday. So, she requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase feeds to sell.

Girlita has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Girlita hopes that she can have agricultural supplies in their area.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Ngelita is single, and has two children. She is 55 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, she sells viand (a tasty dish) and snacks everyday. She has been engaged in this kind of business for five years. She earns PHP 2,800 per month. 

She carries the burden of being a single mother, but this is not a hindrance to continue her dreams. She wants to add kitchen utensils to her small fast food business.  She requested a loan PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional kitchen utensils to have multiple incomes for her children's education.

Ngelita has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to continue her business in a large scale so her children can finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional kitchen utensils

loans.name: Maksuda's Group

texts.en:
Maksuda is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a beautiful ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 47 and divorced, and has raised four children by herself. She has three sons and a daughter; her youngest son and her daughter study at school and her other two sons are employed.

Maksuda is engaged in farming; she cultivates agricultural products and then sells them in order to make money to meet the family's daily needs. She has applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to purchase mineral fertilizers. In the near future, Maksuda plans to celebrate her children’s weddings. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Angelin

texts.en:
Angelin is 44 years old, married and has three children who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. Angelin requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Angelin has been farming vegetables and rice for 10 years now and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her agricultural business.

In the future, Angelin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Riza

texts.en:
Ma. Riza is 38 years old and married with two children. She has been a vegetable farmer for the past six years in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Ma. Riza is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 48 years old and married with two children. She has been running a sari-sari (general) store for the past ten years as well as earning an income from farming rice and vegetables. Nelia works hard to provide for her family.

Nelia has requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. She has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this one.

Nelia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en:
Racquel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a kitchenware dealership in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She also raises pigs to sell.

Racquel has been supplementing her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional kitchenware to sell.

Racquel dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children.

Carmelita has operated a mini grocery store at home for two years, selling all types of food and refreshments. She earns PHP 4,000 per month from this business. She noticed that this is an excellent enterprise for non-working mothers. Carmelita wants to have additional capital to continue this business, so she has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase stock to sell.

Carmelita has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Carmelita wants to expand her store and have a grocery store in her town.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Renelda

texts.en:
Renelda is 38 years old and lives in Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.

Renelda has a business selling fish in the local community. She earns about PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. Renelda has requested a loan to buy fish in her own and in nearby neighborhoods.

Renelda has been a member of PMPC for 1 month. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

location.town: Tamil, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en:
Rudelyn is a single mother with 2 children. She is 27 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rudelyn has been selling snack food in the street for 5 years, earning a living of PHP 2,800 per month. Her income is not enough to sustain her family's daily needs and to provide for her children's education. Therefore, Rudelyn has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to buy ingredients to make her snack food.

Rudelyn has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes that she will have a building for her refreshments so that she can help her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 35 years old and lives in Sigamok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.

Luz has a business selling dried fish in different store locations in town and in the public market. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this work. Luz has requested a loan to purchase dried fish.

Luz has been a member of PMPC for 10 months. In the future, Luz would like to have her own dryer so that she can purchase more fish and dry them on her own.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish

location.town: Sigamok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
For the last 21 years, Nancy has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town. She is 46 years old single mother of two school age children.

She got to know about KADET LTD through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru. This will be her third loan. She paid her previous loan of KES 30,000 in full and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertilizers, and to pay for farm labor and for spraying chemicals.

In the future, Nancy aspires to practice large scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru town

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizers; to pay for farm labor and for  spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Mahabat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabat is the treasurer of this group. She is 41 years old and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she is bringing up two daughters and a son, all of whom study at school. Four years ago with an initial investment of 12000 KGS Mahabat started to sell stationery. At the moment her business runs well, and she earns about $113 per month. This profit made it possible for her to pay for her son’s education in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). With money received from the loan, Mahabat wants to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the near future, with money gained from the trade, she wants to start repairing her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase stationery goods.

loans.name: Manuelita

texts.en:
Manuelita is 58 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children.

Manuelita own a motorcycle cab and earns approximately $116 each month doing this type of business. She lets her motorcycle be rented for her daily income. The spare parts of the motorcycle are damaged and she needs to repair it. At this time Manuelita is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy tires and spare parts for her motorcycle.

She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She dreams that someday she will have additional motor cabs for her business.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella is 31 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with one child. Rosebella has a mini grocery store where she stocks different kinds of food, school supplies and refreshments. She has had this business for four months. She was inspired to continue this kind of business because she noticed that she earned about $245 per month. However, she needed additional capital to continue the business she started. So she requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy school supplies and additional stock to sell.

Rosebella is a new member of GDMPC. In the future she hopes to continue her business and to have a grocery branch in the area.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and more stock to sell.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 29-year-old lady and the mother of two children. She started her own small home business designing and sewing clothes a long time ago. She has gained a wide base of clients through the years. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a cutting machine that will help her productivity. In the future, Fadia would like to have her own sewing workshop and wants to be able to start a fabric trading business.

loans.use: to buy a fabric cutting machine.

loans.name: Samaito

texts.en:
Samaito is single and is living with his parents. He has been planting maize and beans and sells during harvest time. He’s been in this line of work for several years, having learned it from his father. 

He has a good credit history with KADET LTD, and he is applying for his 3rd loan in order to buy farm supplies like manure, insecticide and fertilizer. 

His goal is to help his parents, contribute to his family’s development and forge his future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like manure, insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 52 years old and a single mother of one adult child. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her monthly income is about $113, which she uses to support her family. 

The client is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by the KADET staff. She will use the loan to buy farm products like manure and seedlings. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand the land farming business and venture into dairy farming.  Her hope is to settle down in life after enhancing her income.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita, 21 years old, is married with one child and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Normalita has owned a mini grocery store, selling basic foods such as rice, corn, water, medicine and feed, for more than 2 years. She likes this type of business as she earns PHP 6,000 per month. Normalita wants to double her income, so she needs more capital for her grocery store. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional stock to sell.

Normalita is a new member of GDDMPC. In the future, she hopes to improve her store and be able to display more items.

loans.use: to  purchase additional stock

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 53 years old and lives in Pta. Sulong, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is married and has no children.

Carmelita runs a grocery store and earns approximately Php2,500 each month. She has a requested a loan to purchase additional products to stock her store.

Carmelita has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, 43 years old, is married with 4 children and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To help her family financially, Editha has a mini grocery store that generates PHP 10,000 per month. Editha sells different kinds of food, fruits, spices, and refreshments.

Editha wants to change the building materials of her store because it is constructed only of light materials. Editha has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to buy new building materials for the store. Editha has been a member of GDMPC for more than 4 years. In the future, she hopes that she will have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the store

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. Only her daughters are able to attend school and get an education. Her sons support the family by working for a private organization. Her husband is a milk seller by profession. For that purpose, he has some buffalos at home. He takes their milk everyday and sells to community clients and milk shops for good profit. 

Sughran is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household tasks but in her spare time she also supports her husband by taking care of the cattle and milking them. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, because her husband wants to buy another buffalo for the further expansion of his milk selling business. This will provide him more milk and increase his profits by selling more. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Sughran is very confident that by purchasing another buffalo he will not only build an asset for his business but also improve his income. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last three years. He is 48 years old, married to Esther, and they are blessed with four school-aged children. 

Zablon got to know about KADET LTD through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru. This will be his fourth loan. Zablon repaid his previous loans of KES 70,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizers, to pay for farm labor and to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat for his retail shop. In the future, Zablon hopes to own a supermarket in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, to pay for farm labor and to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat for his retail shop

loans.name: Lureen

texts.en:
Lureen is a 21-year-old wife who has a one-year-old son. Lureen's husband runs a grocery store in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Lureen and her husband moved to a new house in a residential complex that had no grocery store at the time so having the store led to good business.
Lureen has taken out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to purchase a fridge for displaying items and goods to sell in the store.
Lureen is a conservative woman, as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants, therefore her husband is shown in the photograph instead.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and goods to sell in the grocery store.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Glenda works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Glenda is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her bakery business.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a frozen food business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy frozen foods.

Nemia has been in this business for two years. Nemia earns more income from farming rice and vegetables.

Nemia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other gear for fishing.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fish nets and other gear for fishing.

loans.name: Rizeq

texts.en: Rizeq is a young man from Sanour village in Jineen district, which is famous for its cacti and olive trees. Rizeq is a father of two sons and has a grocery store. He needs $500 to purchase goods and items to exhibit and sell in his store. Rizeq, who is photographed here, has taken a loan for this amount from Kiva partner, FATEN.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in his store.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last four years. He is 51 years old and a widower.

Joel was introduced to KADET LTD by an officer from the KADET LTD Ndunyu Njeru office. This will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy seedlings and fertilizers and to pay for farm labor. In the future, Joel hopes to increase his farm production by practicing large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers and to pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Jean has operated a vegetable garden for 5 years. She harvests vegetables such as eggplants and string beans to sell. Jean has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for her vegetable plants. Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for vegetable plants

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1967. She lives in Xom Trong village, Uy No commune, with her husband and two children. She and her husband are farmers. Not only do they grow rice but she also sells fruit in the market. She has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006. 

For her last loan, she borrowed 6.758.000 VND and repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8.502.000 VND to expand her business further.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Serzhik

texts.en:
Serzhik was born in 1983 in Hand village, Syunik marz.  He works as a machine operator and, at the same time, he has done farming for over 7 years. On his farm he has 2 cows, 2 pigs and 10 bee hives.  Also, Serzhik grows oats as fodder for his farm animals. His wife takes care of their two little daughters and helps Serzhik in farming. They work very hard and thus they are able to support their young family. 

Serzhik needs a 400,000 AMD loan to buy diesel fuel for his reaper, and wax papers and frames for his beehives.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel for the reaper, and also wax papers and frames for his beehives

loans.name: Sijohidin

texts.ru: Сичохидин проживает в районе Кумсангир. Он женат. У него 5 детей. Ему 34 года. Он уже четыре года как занимается растениеводством. Не далеко от дома у него имеется большой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и сеет кукурузу. Он берет кредит для закупа семян кукурузы, минеральных удобрений и солярки.
texts.en: Sijohidin lives in Qumsangir.  He is married and has five children.  He is 34 years old.  He has been farming for four years.   He has a large plot of land not far from home.  There he grows vegetables and plants corn.  He is taking out a loan to buy corn seed, mineral fertilizer, and diesel.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and diesel.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 40-year-old woman who is married to Abd Aljaleel. They have five children. Maha wanted to support her husband and her family, but at the same time wanted to dedicate herself to her children, so she opened a small food store in their neighborhood for her husband two years ago, and it has been running very successfully. Now Maha has applied for a loan to buy products for the store that their customers are asking for but that they do not presently stock.
Since Maha is a conservative person, her husband Abd Aljaleel appears in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more food and drink products for her food store.

loans.name: Mysan

texts.en:
Mysan is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.  Mysan has a shop in which she sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Mysan has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Mysan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Marybeth

texts.en:
Marybeth is 22 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marybeth has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Marybeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old and married to Cicilia . He supports five people in his family.  He has run a transport business for two years.

He has applied for his second loan of KES.25,000 from KADET LTD.   He intends to use the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. 

His dream is to own many motorbikes and to lease them to support his family.  He hopes to help his children go to higher learning institutions.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is 43 years old and has given birth to four children. Only two of them are able to attend school, while the others stay at home and help their parents with the routine work. Her husband is a milk seller by profession. He has 11 buffalos at home. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and has full support of Kosar who takes care of his cattle and provides them with timely food and water. His business has vastly expanded and he makes a good income from it. Due to the good quality of his milk, his clientele base is increasing day by day. He needs to expand his business further, so Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will help him fulfill the orders of his customers and get more milk. 

Kosar is hopeful that an investment will help her husband improve his business further and help her family to live a better financial life.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a lumber yard in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional lumber to sell.

Alejandra has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business further in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional lumber to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Joseph has a food shop and sells chicken and pork barbecue. He  had this business for three years. He requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients like meat and food seasoning for barbecues. He also continues in providing motorela (motorcycle transport) services and his wife manages their food shop.

Joseph has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future,  Joseph  hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat and food seasoning for barbecues

loans.name: Erana

texts.en: Erana is 39 years old. She's currently in a business of selling tea. She is married to a businessman and they have no children. Her future goal is to extend her business.

loans.use: to stock more tea.

loans.name: Annie Rose

texts.en:
Annie Rose is 33 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Annie Rose has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for one year and also earns an income from farming and hog raising.

Annie Rose aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Marife has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, biscuits and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Marife has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Marife hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан житель района Кумсангир. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него 7 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается растениеводством. В основном он выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений и солярки для трактора.
texts.en: Hasan lives in Qumsangir.  He is 42 years old, married, and has seven children.  His wife is a housewife.  He is a farmer.  He primarily grows vegetables to sell.  He has been doing this work for seven years.  He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and diesel for the tractor.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and diesel for the tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Elsie has a shop in which she sells candies, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy snacks, candies, biscuits, powdered milk & chocolate drinks.

Elsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Elsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candies, biscuits, powdered milk & chocolate drinks

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Teresita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1983. She is married with a child. She lives in Xom Trong village. Her husband is a driver. She sells clothes  in the market. She has had this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. 

For her last loan, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND to expand her clothes shop.

loans.use: to expand her clothes shop.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Carlita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store and hog raising. Carlita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Carlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius Wanyama is  28 years and runs a motorcycle spare parts shop in Kitale town. 

He has been in this business for five years and he is applying for a loan of KES.60,000, with which he intends to expand the business by adding more stock.
 
His dream is to have a big spare part outlet and improve the living standards of the family

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is married with two children. She is 36 years old and lives in Delusom, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. Ana sells fish in the local community to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase materials for repairing her house, such as nails, galvanized iron, and wood. Ana has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Ana hopes to have good living conditions and a progressive business, with the help of PMPC and its partners.

loans.use: to purchase materials for repairing her house, such as nails, galvanized iron, and wood

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 29 years old, married and has four children. Two of her children study while the others are less than four years of age and have not started their education yet.
Sonia's husband sells milk. He has two buffalo and three cows at home. He milks them twice a day and sells the milk to customers in his community. His rates are reasonable, which is why he has a good number of customers in his area. In order to financially support her husband, Sonia sews clothes. She is very good at her work and receives a good number of orders every month. She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Sonia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband so that he can buy another buffalo to increase milk productivity and sales. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Sonia hopes that an investment will bring more profits to him.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 32 years old. She is a married businesswoman who supports a family of four members. She has been running her business of second-hand clothes for the last three years.

This is her first loan of 17,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase assorted bales of skirts and T-shirts for sale. 

This will help boost her business and she will use the proceeds to expand her business and settle her family by the purchase of a residential plot.

loans.use: to buy bales of skirts and t-shirts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Born in 1983, Mai lives in Xom Trong village, Uy No commune with her husband and a son. Her husband is a driver. Mai grows rice and vegetables and sells lottery tickets as well. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND.

Mai has secured loans from SEDA since 2007 and always has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Hiền's Group

texts.en:
Hiền, 41, is married and has two school-aged children. She lives in the town of Yen Phong district, Băc Ninh province. Hiền is the leader of a three-member group, Đông Mai 2 (2.1), that is obtaining a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

To making a living, Hiền is a woodworker, manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Hiền has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month.

In 2009, Hiền joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a loan of 6,944,000 VND from SEDA (this loan will be the third taken out by Hiền from SEDA). This previous loan was used to purchase wood and other materials. She is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase more materials to expand her product offerings to such items as tables and chairs.

Hiền plans to use her additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Loan is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 8,288,000 VND loan to support her business making furniture such as tables and chairs . 2. Phố is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her business raising pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to expand her product offerings to such items as tables and chairs.

loans.name: Crispy

texts.en:
Crispy is 31 years old and married with three children. Crispy has been raising pigs for twelve years and also earns additional income from selling Avon products.

Crispy is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as manure and seedlings

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Romeo has a shop that makes and sells home-made ice cream. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for home-made ice cream.
Romeo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Romeo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for home-made ice cream

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim (in the photo) is 29 years old and her husband, Bunly, is 33 years old. They have been married since 2004 and just have a young daughter. The family lives in a village on National Road number two, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Sarim and her husband are rice farmers. They also raise pigs at home. Sarim hopes to expand her pig farming by buying more piglets. So, she is asking for her first loan of $500.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Kanyshai's Group

texts.en:
Kanyshai is the leader of this group. She is 53 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised two daughters and two sons. The daughters are married and live separately with their families and the sons help Kanyshai run the family business. Kanyshai works as a teacher; in parallel with her job she sells children’s clothing. She started this business five years ago with the initial investment of 10 000 soms. Her friend, who has been in this business for a long time, helped in the initial stages. At the moment Kanyshai’s monthly profit is 10 000 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to repair her house. In the future she wants to see her sons get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan (pictured above) is a mason. His wife, Chanthy, is a garment worker. They have two young children: one son and one daughter. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chan is requesting a loan of $1,200 to build a restroom and kitchen.

loans.use: To build a restroom and kitchen.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 65 years old and lives in Plaride, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 10 children.

To earn a living, Dionesia has a business selling different kinds of snacks. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Dionesia has a requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Dionesia has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.
