loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Nhhoep

texts.en:
Nhhoep has been a silk weaver for more than 30 years. Her husband has been a primary teacher for more than 30 years. Nhhoep is asking for her second loan of 1,000 USD to put a new roof on her house because she and her husband are old and broke. She will use a part of her loan to continue her weaving business by buying silk materials.

Photo: Nhhoep and her husband.

loans.use: to put a new roof on her house and buy silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Letoya

texts.en:
Letoya is a very meticulous man who practices land farming in Oleserian-Narok, Kenya. He has been in this business for over 12 years and earns a monthly profit of 6,000 KES. He is 51 years old, married, and a father of 5 children.


Letoya paid his previous loans in time and he is applying for his third loan. He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy farm inputs. He intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay his children's school fees. 


He hopes to develop his business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Maribel has a retail shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy t-shirts, blouses & underwear to sell.
Maribel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Maribel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses & underwear to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios, 60, is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She has run a retailing business for almost 10 years. Her net income is PHP 3,500 monthly. She's asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles, coffee and sugar to sell. Remedios works hard and sacrifices a lot in order to make her business grow. She prays that KIVA lenders will continually give her assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, noodles, coffee and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Mengly

texts.en:
Mengly, 57 years old, is a goldsmith, and his income is $15 per day. His wife takes care of their children at home. They have two children who are  working as construction workers. 

Every month, he has to spend $90 on food, $10 on electricity, and $15 for other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for his son to go to work. He plans to repair his shop and house to look better than now if he has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his son to go to work.

loans.name: Sausan

texts.en:
Sausan is a housewife. She has no children and lives in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Sausan's husband is a plumber and has a workshop in the city where he also sells water network pipes, filters and other items.
Sausan has taken out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, for her husband to replace the tools he is using as they are becoming very old. Her husband is well known in his area and fixes plumbing problems in almost all the houses in the area. However, due to the current financiA. situation customers do not pay the fees all in cash. Therefore, Sausan has had to take the loan to buy the tools.
Sausan's husband appears in the picture because Sausan is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase new plumbing tools to replace old ones.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap and her husband, Sam Oeun, have been married since 2004 and have one young daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sopheap is a weaver while her husband raises chickens at home. She is requesting a loan of $600 to help her husband’s chicken raising business by purchasing additional chickens and chicken feed.   

Photo: Sopheap and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, 42 years old, is currently in the business of selling vegetables. She is married to a farmer and they have six children, none of whom are at school. Her future goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Raffy

texts.en:
Raffy is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. 
Raffy has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional t-shirts, blouses & underwear.
Raffy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Raffy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional t-shirts, blouses & underwear

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 23 years old and has a two year old child. Her husband is a welder. She owns a shop where she has been selling food stuffs for the past two years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items to make more profit. She plans to save the profits.

loans.use: to purchase items for sale.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is married. Her husband has four buffaloes at his home. He sells their milk to customers in the community and to milk shops. Zahra is a housewife who stays at home and carries out her household duties. But in her spare time, she also helps her husband to take care of the buffalo. Zahra is a mother of three sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting an education.
Zahra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to help her husband to improve his business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo, which will allow him to get more milk and sell in larger quantities. This will provide a better income. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Zahra hopes that an investment will bring better profits to him and help her family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 55 years old and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children.

Editha has a business selling different snacks. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month. Editha has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Editha has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Dezi

texts.en: Dezi is an individual client from Bushenyi. She is 47 years old and is married with 8 children; 4 of them are still in school. She sells bananas and milk from her farm in Muzira village. Her customers are mostly village residents and traders. She is able to make 50,000 profit per week from her business of 20 years. All she wanted was a source of income and her hard work has brought her this far. Her dream is to have all her children finish school and she is grateful that she has learnt how to save. Dezi needs a loan to be able to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and manure for her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizers and manure for her farm

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 32 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for horticultural seeds

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 30 years old, is married and the father of two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past eight years. 

He has been a good client. He has applied for his fifth loan with KADET LTD which he will use to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds) and also to prepare land. With the profits generated he plans to pay his children's school fees.

He dreams of being a prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite his limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds) and to prepare land

loans.name: Elvira's Group

texts.en:
Elvira is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she has raised three daughters.  The youngest daughter is at school and the other daughters study at university. Elvira works as a nurse in the hospital. She receives a monthly salary of 5600 soms. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs additional money to purchase furniture to improve the family’s living conditions. In the future, Elvira wants to see her daughters get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to improve the family's living conditions

loans.name: Eveliza

texts.en:
Eveliza is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Eveliza has a retail shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing & snacks like breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts & blouses.
Eveliza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Eveliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts & blouses

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 50, is married and blessed with 3 children. She has been managing a retail store for almost 10 years. She earns 2,500 PHP a month. She's asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her store. She plans to save more from her income for future emergencies. Also, she wants her children to complete their education.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase piglets and to construct a pig pen to hold them.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel.  She is married with 7 children.

Gloria works in the fish industry and both catches and sells fish for a living.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase equipment for her fish cages.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her fish cages

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Julieta has a food shop that sells longganiza or home made sausages.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like ground meat and food seasoning.

Julieta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like ground meat and food seasoning

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for tilling the farm and for horticultural seeds

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years old, married to Jacob and supports a family of three children. She has run a retail shop for the last seven years.

With her first loan of 10,000 KES from KADET Ltd., she wants to purchase additional stock like tea leaves and washing detergents to sell. 

The anticipated profit will enable her to repay and expand her business.  Her future dreams are to have a wholesale shop and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Aloha

texts.en:
Aloha is 35 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Aloha has a mini grocery store that sells all kinds of food and refreshments. She has had this type of business for two years and she earns 6,000 PHP every month.  But Aloha wanted to have additional capital to purchase additional stock of refreshments, so she requested a loan from GDMPC of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional refreshments to sell.

Aloha is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, she hopes that she can be a stockholder of refreshment products in their community.

loans.use: to purchase additional refreshment products to sell

loans.name: Gakii

texts.en:
Gakii has been a resident and farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya for 13 years.  She has been producing french beans, potatoes and milk and selling to the local market.

Gakii has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to buy dairy goats and construct a zero-grazing unit (barn or shed) on her farm. She intends to advance her dairy goat farming and keep cows in the future. She says she will fully rely on the farming income for the upkeep of her children.

She notes that insufficient water is a challenge for the farming business.

loans.use: to pay for dairy goats and construction of a dairy unit

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child.

Emmanuel is providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) services. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

Emmanuel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emmanuel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 29 years old. She has four children who are ages three to fifteen years. Three of the children are in school while the youngest is not yet in school.

Anathasie owns a shop in which she sells different items such as sugar, rice, etc. She is requesting a loan to buy items such as rice, cooking oil, etc. With the profits, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop such as rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the construction of a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Tashinga B Seke South Group

texts.en:
This is 65-year-old Ruth (in the middle) from Chitungwiza, a high-density suburb about 30 km. from Harare. She is married with three children, all attending school. She also cares for four dependents.

Ruth runs a clothing business selling ladies clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge faced is the lack of capital to meet her order demands. Ruth has requested a loan of $400 to buy shoes and suits for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family’s cash flow and quality of life.

In the future, Ruth plans to have her own clothing shop and see her grandchildren through their education.

loans.use: to buy stock such as shoes and suits

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 41 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children.

Editha owns a refreshment stall in the market thats sells soft drinks, juice, yogurt, tea, and other refreshments. She has had this business for two years earning a monthly income of PHP 10,000. Editha wanted to add more stocks to sell. She went to GDMPC to request a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase stocks of refreshments.

Editha is a new member of GDMPC. She hopes that someday she will become a refreshment stockholder.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of refreshments

loans.name: Nheap

texts.en:
Nheap is 57 years old. She is a vegetable seller with her husband. Their income is $8 per day. They have six children, and they are 30, 28, 25, 23, 21, and 17 years old. Five of them are studying and one is working in an organization for $7 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $85 on food, $15 on utilities, $70 on school fees, $25 on transportation and $19 for other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy rice seed and other seeds for planting to sell. 

She wants to send all of her children to study until they finish university, so she needs to make more income to keep for them when they need it for their school fees.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and other planting seeds.

loans.name: Burulsun's Group

texts.en:
Burulsun is the treasurer of this group. She is 38 and is married to a welder. Together with her husband she is bringing up a daughter and a son. The daughter, 16, graduates from school this year and the son, 19, studies in the lyceum (teaching institution). In order to earn money, the family breeds livestock and sells agricultural products such as apples and peaches. They also resell livestock at a higher price after they have been fattened. With money received from the loan, Burulsun wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Pelicia

texts.en:
Pelicia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Pelicia has a retail shop that sells CTF WELLNESS products like coffee. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy CTF WELLNESS products such as coffee.
Pelicia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy CTF WELLNESS products like coffee
